reviewText: As a "dog show person" I wasn't sure what to expect!! Would I be offended?  Would it make fun of "us"?  You bet it did, and I loved every minute of it!! I saw it with another dog show friend and we were laughing more than anyone in the theater.  You have to enjoy off beat humor, which we do.  The funniest movie I have seen in a long, long time.  The buzz in the real dog show world is that most people loved it!

Christopher Guest and Eugene Levy are masters of subtle humor.  Their movies do not have the in-your-face/big puchline type jokes.  This is why their movies are generally released to "Art Houses" rather than the Hollywood Colossal-Plex theaters.  Best in Show is the latest installment in the "mockumentary" genre created by Guest.  Best in Show is more like Waiting for Guffman than This is Spinal Tap.  Like Guffman, Best in Show introduces the characters one-by-one during Act I.  You learn that each character has his own flaw (or flaws), and each has a quirky history.  What I love about the characters in Guest/Levy's films is that great care is gone in to creating them.  There are no "throw away" characters.  It's obvious that these guys love the roles they created.  I loved Spinal Tap and Guffman and this film fits in the genre beautifully.  I wouldn't say that this humor is for everyone.  This is very much unlike "Ace Ventura" or "Scary Movie."  Jokes develop slowly but have big yet subtle pay-offs.  I eagerly await the DVD and Guest/Levy's next installment!

Eugene Levy and Christopher Guest have pulled off another great "mockumentary" surrounding the owners of show-dogs as they compete in what appears to be the superbowl of Dog Shows.

Following a series off characters, all of whom are odd in some way, makes for great entertainment.  The low-budget nature of the film adds to its realistic hilarity, though at times the humour is a bit over-the-top.  I found myself laughing frequently at this film, enjoying the strange and eccentric people that continually parade across the screen - and that doesn't even take into account the dogs!  Which reminds me - if you love dogs, as I do, then you will enjoy the many and varied canines that are on display here.

I particularly commend Levy as an awkward, sensitive man with two left feet - literally.  His constant demeanor of confusion and caring is hilarious and highlights Levy's comedic abilities that have made me laugh for 15 years since SCTV reruns where on TV.

I was also surprised and delighted by Fred Willard's absolutely hilarious role as the half-witted, over-talkative and misinformed announcer for the dog show.  His antics were brilliantly pulled off and were the source of a great deal of my laughter.

This movie in style, comedy and even characters is little different from Waiting for Guffman (I have not seen This is Spinal Tap), so if you did not like Guffman's brand of humour, you will want to avoid this.

Otherwise, sit back and enjoy!

I went to my local theater last night and found that, unless I wanted to wait another hour, I only had two options: BEST IN SHOW or a film about little kids during the Holocaust.  After reading the dreary synopsis of the Holocaust movie, I needed a laugh so BEST IN SHOW won out by default.  I had heard a couple of glowing reviews so I anticipated laughing 'til I peed my pants.
  The best I can say about this film is that it is relatively entertaining (in a way I hadn't expected), but chockful of big yuks it's not.  In fact, I can recall only a half-dozen or so decent laughs.  None of it came close to leaving me rolling in the aisle.  Christopher Guest's satirical humor appears to be one of those acquired tastes that makes only certain people roar with laughter and is definitely NOT what most folks think of as situational comedy.
  Guest's film is an ersatz documentary that focuses primarily on several hopeful dog owners who have entered their prize-winning purebreds in The Mayflower, a fictional granddaddy of all dog shows held in Philadelphia.  The featured contenders run the gamut:
There's a wealthy, foppish gay couple and one of their two Shih Tzus.
  There's a heavily made-up gold-digger and her butch poodle handler (the gold-digger's first interview is the funniest part of the whole movie).
Parker Posey is fantastic as the "better" half of an ill-matched wannabe yuppie couple with major Type-A personalities and a Weimaraner that harbors dubious hostility toward her owners' equally dubious sexual escapades.
Another team is comprised of a hopeless geek, his blowsy wife (a formerly libidinous former barfly played by the amazing Catherine O'Hara) and a terrier from suburban Florida.
And, finally, there's a gentle yokel from the South (played endearingly by Guest himself) and his beautiful bloodhound.
Throw in the dog show organizer, the hotel manager (Ed Begley, who did an excellent job with a small role) and a stupid, annoying, loudmouth color commentator (played by Fred Willard) and you've pretty much got the cast. According to Roger Ebert, Willard "steals the show."  He did no such thing.  In fact, he's the main reason NOT to watch this movie.  He was the polar opposite of funny.  "Corny" is about generous as I can be.
With that notable exception aside, what BEST IN SHOW lacks in laughs is more than made up for by the characterizations impressively fleshed out by Guest and his stars.  The rabid regulars on the dog show circuit were entirely believable, particularly with regard to the naivete of their dialogue and their interaction among friends, family and the competition.
At times, the whole scenario was reminiscent of the cheap notoriety and common vulgarity that pervades those behind-the-scenes looks at little girls' beauty pageants, replete with stressed out stage moms and the self-imposed pre-show pressure that verges on abuse.  It was this aspect of the film -- the big fish in a little pond -- that earned my conditional respect.
The dry wit of BEST IN SHOW is often mildly amusing, but it's inconsistent and that left quite a few boring, sometimes annoying, lulls in my interest.  Contrarily, this movie surprises with other mostly positive attributes that a select audience might find appealing enough to make it worth renting.

I have to admit that I was a little apprehensive when I went to see "Best In Show".  After the first 10 minutes, I realized that I was in for a great ride.  I won't go into details (you can read Tom Reynolds review above for the plot), but I will say that this is one of the funniest movies I've seen a some time.  The characters are funny yet strangely believable.  I personally found Fred Willard's character a laugh riot.  It's one of those movies where you find yourself repeating funny lines from the movie for days.  See it before it leaves the theaters; you won't regret it!

If you saw Spinal Tap you know what Christopher Guest is capable of as far as so true, yet so "out there" pseudo Documentary. Best In Show is of the same calibre, the addition of Eugene Levy, and a great supporting cast of seasoned actors and actresses makes this only the more enjoyable movie, we enjoyed this movie and received the best "belly laughs" in a long while. So grab your popcorn and grab your favorite canine and watch and enjoy this work of comedic genius!.

Writer/director Christopher Guest takes a look at the relationship between Man and that most loyal of beasts, the dog, in "Best In Show," a humorous satire presented in the same "mock documentary" style as Rob Reiner's "This Is Spinal Tap."  It's a keen observation of human nature, as it is much more about the owners and handlers than about the dogs themselves, and much as David Byrne did with "True Stories," Guest presents a diverse community united by a single, common thread, that being their love for their dogs, and aspirations of winning the blue ribbon in the upcoming competition that will go to the top dog overall, the Best In Show.  Through a series of interviews and memorable scenes, we are introduced to the owners and their beloved canines who will soon square off in the arena at the world class Mayflower Dog Show in Philadelphia.  We get to know a bit about each of the participants, so we know just who they are and where they come from.  Guest has assembled a terrific ensemble cast, who bring it all to life by creating a rich tapestry of characters culled from a true cross section of Americana:  Good ol' boy Harlan Pepper (Guest), with his Bloodhound, "Hubert", from Pine Nut, North Carolina; a somewhat neurotic young couple from Illinois, Meg and Hamilton Swan (Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock), members of the "Starbucks" set with their Weimaraner, "Beatrice;" Gerry and Cookie Fleck (Eugene Levy and Catherine O'Hara), a couple who could be anybody's next door neighbors, with their Norwich Terrier, "Winky", from Fern City, Florida;  Leslie and Sheri Ann Ward Cabot (Patrick Cranshaw and Jennifer Coolidge) a wealthy couple who have a Standard Poodle, "Rhapsody In White", entrusted to the care of professional handler Christy Cummings (Jane Lynch); and finally, another couple, Scott Donlan and Stefan Vanderhoof (John Michael Higgins and Michael McKean), with their precious Shih Tzus, "Miss Agnes."  This is a highly entertaining, funny movie, filled with wry, subtle humor that is delivered straight and never played for laughs, which makes it believable and real, and all the more hilarious.  This is quite a group of characters, eclectic to say the least, and they're all real people.  You're bound to run into someone you know among them.  The dialogue is sharp, and rife with dry wit.  And for anyone who's ever watched any kind of sporting event on television, you'll appreciate the parody of the so-called "color commentator," in this case a guy named Buck Laughlin (Fred Willard), that is dead on the money.  His comments during an interview to a nonplused Dr. Millbank (Bob Balaban) about Columbus landing at Plymouth Rock will have you on the floor.  There is so much here you can relate to, and it's all done in such good fun.  Rounding out the outstanding supporting cast are Don Lake (Graham Chissolm), Jim Piddock (Trevor Beckwith), Ed Begley, Jr. (Hotel manager), Linda Kash (Fay Berman), Larry Miller (Max Berman) and Don S. Davis (Best In Show Judge).  The performances here are good all around, with especially notable turns by O'Hara, Levy, Guest, Lynch and Willard.  Written by Guest and Levy, "Best In Show" works so well because it holds up a mirror and reflects the lives we all lead in one way or another.  As we watch, we realize that even as we are laughing at all of these characters and situations, at the same time we're laughing at ourselves as well; because there's more than a little bit of each one of us in there somewhere.  And it reminds us that when things seem to be getting too serious, it's time to pick up that mirror and take a good look; and thanks to the frame of reference that a movie like this provides, you just may find something to laugh about, and be able to discover the "Best In Show" in your own life.

An excellent film from an ensemble cast of comedians. Funny. Hilarious. Good, good movie. Eugene Levy will make you laugh, the poodle will make you cry. Great insight on the real lives of show dog owners and their handlers; trust me, we've all been there. Also very in depth on the true lives of these world-famous dog handlers. Filmed in the style of a documentary, the grittiness and realism of each scene had me screaming for mercy. If you want an a-okay movie to watch on a quiet night in with the hubby and kids, buy three copies of this film just in case you burn through the first two.

This is a mokumentary of the dog beauty show pageant industry where the cameras follow a number of owners of previous year or lesser dog show  winners as they prepare to travel to and for the second half of the movie, stay at the hotel and compete in the dog show.  All the owners are societal loser types, some rich, some financially struggling. All unlikable characters.  I found the first half of the movie, very boring, but to give the mokumentary credit it does improve once the owners reach the hotel.  But the thing is how many people pressed the stop button and ejected the movie before getting there?  The second half is on par with a three store movie, the first wouldn't even rate one.

But as for the rest of the dog owner characters, they were pretty one-dimensional and their 'quirks' pretty predictable and not that outstanding.  I actually found Parker Posey's character to be rather poorly fleshed-out (and typicallly I love Parker Posey...)

I rewatch this comedic "mockumentary" every few years and still burst out laughing at the situations and sarcasm directed at the quirky dog owners. (The dogs themselves are beautiful, and treated respectfully by the director, Christopher Guest, who also happens to play a dog owner with ventriloquism skills.) A word of advice: this is the kind of movie where you need to sit down and pay all your attention to the dialog. Watch for the way the hostage negotiator deals with his son refusing to come down from a tree, and look for the ongoing cheeky/ random comments by a dog show commentator (Fred Willard), endured by his long-suffering British counterpoint (Jim Piddock).
Quirky fun, just like dog-people.

Of course, I did a lot of dog showing when I was younger,and I can tell you, there isn't a character in this movie that isn't a part of dog shows, and who I haven't met !! The 'acting' didn't even seem like acting!! Those people were REAL in every way! But you don't have to be a dog handler at all! You will see people you know who are a lot like these characters, and they are characters, without a doubt. So sit back and enjoy a relatively short movie, full of laughs and just good fun! I guarantee it!!

This is a classic comedy with one of my favorite ensemble of actors....Whether on their own or laughing it up with each other, they bring a variety of laughs in different movies..... consistently over the years...If you can laugh at those of us who are ''Crazy for Cocoa puffs'' for our dogs, if you love it when you see people who have found their nutty quirky soul mate...(whether its their dog or another hilarious human who shares their crazy view of the world of dog shows and dogs), you will love each and everyone here....its just silly enough to make you laugh and laugh and laugh but not so silly to turn some people off....and I guarantee you will definitely want to watch this over and over...therefore, this is a must purchase movie so you can pull it out whenever you want.  I bought two DVD copies of this movie, lent them out over the years, and of course, couldn't convince my friends to return them....so now I will have to come back to Amazon and stop renting and buy my own copy...

Whether you think dogs are nutty and that their owners can be nutty, if you think dog shows are a circus of nuttiness, or if you love nutty people, nutty dogs and are a fan of dog shows, either way, you will love this movie....

You will also enjoy seeing some comedians you haven't seen in a while,  Jane Lynch way back before her huge presence on the TV and movie screens and some comedians you can't get enough of (all of this cast),

If you don't laugh out loud very much lately, and our stressful lives can do that to us without us noticing...then get out the popcorn, a couple of beers or soda, put your feet up and start laughing OUT LOUD once again....

and it never fails to make me laugh. It may not be everyone's cuppa tea - notice that only about 80 percent of reviewers rate it 4 stars or above. That only tells me that people who don't find it at all funny probably laugh at things that I would not like - it takes all kinds, and thank goodness for diversity. What I like most about this is that, to me, the dialog seems less scripted than spontaneously improvised, and that most of the funniest things are presented as not funny at all - such as Harlan's very serious musings about nuts ... reminded me SO much of my dad lecturing me about the fine points of his favorite camera for no reason at all. Years ago I had a friend who had no sense of humor but was the funniest person I ever met just because she never said anything that was intended to be funny - like when we got a Danish guy joined our car-pool and she asked him "Do they have dogs in Denmark?" or asking a mutual friend from England how she came to the states by asking "Did you fly or drive?" If you don't think these examples are hilarious, then Best in Show is definitely not for you.

The loosely scripted improv "mockumentary" format of this and other movies by this group works very well in the setting of crazy world of dog shows. The cast manages to capture several major stereotypes of dog owners very well and actually make you believe that it could be real. Some who are unfamiliar with this format/genre may find it slow-paced, but there is a lot of humor buried in the execution of this movie. I just wonder how hard it was for the actors to keep a straight face when shooting the movie.

For reasons related to the existence of Prime, I've finally seen this whole film, end to end. Never any belly laughs, but LOADS of little chuckles that make you wish that someone was watching with you so you could say to them "Did you see THAT?" It's helpful under those circumstances if you're accustomed to talking to yourself, which I am, and boy, did I have a good time! No popcorn or soda, but a continual sense of slack-jawed amazement over the astonishingly vivid and crazily accurate portrayals of all the characters who, in their insanely interwoven and simultaneously separate lives, do improbable things with improbable animals to win a bit of ribbon (and a somewhat larger bit of international renown). Imagine Tom Wolfe via Salvador Dali, with maybe a dash of Martha Stewart. Zowie!!!!

"Best in Show" has an honored place in my DVD cabinet, along with "Waiting for Guffman", early Woody Allen comedies, and Wes Anderson's "The Royal Tannenbaums".  I guess I've given myself away here; I'm not a hit-you-over-head comedy lover, although I loved Lucille Ball (another comedic genius) -- but you could definitely appreciate "The Forty-Year-Old Virgin" and still enjoy "Best in Show", or any of Guest's brilliant comedies.  "Best in Show" is done in Guest's signature mockumentary style, reminiscent of Woody Allen's early comedies ("Take the Money and Run", "Zelig"), but Guest puts his own mark on this style and makes it his own.  His casting, as usual, is impeccable, and many of my favorites from "Waiting for Guffman" are here: Catherine O'Hara and Eugene Levy, playing a down-on-their-luck couple obsessed with their terrier; Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock as a totally strung-out lawyer couple whose Weimaraner takes on their own angst; Jennifer Coolidge as an Anna Nicole Smith-type dog owner who hires Jane Lynch as her dog's trainer and sparks fly; John Michael Higgins and Michael McKean as a flamboyantly gay couple with a shih-tzu; and of course, Bob Balaban and Fred Willard.  All are absolutely brilliant and their improvisation beyond compare.  I tire of Fred Willard a little bit when I re-watch this, as I do about once a year.  That is about the only criticism I can give, and it isn't really a criticism, because I howled with laughter the first few times.  The bizarro world of dog showing and dog competitions is what the plot revolves around, but it so much more than that.  Buy it along with "Waiting for Guffman" and sit back and prepare to be hilariously entertained.

I have had several German Shepherds that have developed hip dysplasia. This genetic problem has occurred with increased frequency during the past decades due to line breeding by the breeders. The breeders are attempting to produce a dog that will meet the so called breed standards; these "standards" must be met if a dog is to do well in dog shows. I think the movie uses humour in order to reveal how stupid dog shows really are.

I thought this was a funny movie when I first saw it because of my interest in dogs, Now that I am showing dogs I think it's hysterical. The Shit-zhu loving couple ( gay) are way over the top. And the Poodle owners and their handler take dog-showing to the limit. Of the two commentators, one of them can barely control his desire to send the other one "to the moon". This is a perfect mockumentary using real people in a real situation with actors taking over the scenario to make it less than believable, but way too funny.

In this hysterical comedy, the "Dog-Eat-Dog" - world, centralizes at a Blue Ribbon, Dog Show Competition, that has the respective dog owners and their unique and diverse personalities, at each others throats. After all..., that blue piece of velvet material fashioned in a big bow, is worth it. Is it not? The show dogs that were registered for the contest, definitely don't know the difference. Because all they seem to care about, is the free room-n-board, complimentary hair-care and grooming, doggie spa baths complete with four-legged pedicures, individual attention and biscuits a plenty. And, for this  "...hope to win..." Doggie-Distinction Award along with the big, gold-colored, Awards Cup, a slightly moronic Florida couple whose credit cards are totally worthless, having travelled all the way up North for their adorable pooch to be apart of this prestigious Competition, allow themselves to be housed within a hotel, custodial, chemical closet. Obviously, they LOVE their pooch. Next, comes the lesbian couple wherein the woman who dresses, looks and acts like a man, comes out-of-the-closet and publicly in a television interview, surprise, surprise... "discloses", that she is the disciplinarian complete with spankings, for both women and dogs. These two characters are followed by a homosexual couple, one of whom decided to start redecorating the hotel room that they were staying in and almost misses the Dog Show Competition, because out of several suitcases full of clothing, he can't decide what to wear!? But, no need to fear, his lover "Daddy", managed to get him dressed and there, just in time. These obvious, neurotic, group therapy, candidates..., are followed and up-staged by two absolutely psychotic and probably bipolar, so-called attorneys, who evidently suffer from acute anxiety attacks who met and married over their shared love of their coffee lattes. In addition too, their being "law-suit happy" over their dog's 'Busy-Bee', chew toy. Also, neither of them can stand people in general or the clients that they represent, so they found their way around having to deal with mankind by conveniently ordering through catalogs. And, too top it all off, they are firm believer's that 'Psychiatry for their Dog', is where it's at! And, oh yes, last but not least..., the two mismatched, Doggie Show Commentators: One of which is a bonafide idiot whose in love with himself, the sound of his own voice, his 'off the wall opinions' and doesn't know when to shut up. And the other distinct moron, a so-called, grown man, who doesn't have the gut's to tell him, "...to put a lid on it!" All of it!! So, who wins the big, blue, velvet, bow-tie and big, gold-colored, metal, Doggie Cup Award? Watch and see, and laugh all the way, around. This really is, in every sense of the word: A very funny, furry and cuddly, comedy. So, pop the popcorn and enjoy! :) Nina Kish

One of the funniest and most accessible of Christopher Guest's wonderful improvisational comedies. Every character in this film is fully realized: they are delightfully eccentric dog trainers who manage to seem both bizarre and familiar. I'd be willing to watch an entire film centered around any one of these characters. The actors are so damn good at creating their quirky personae that you may will likely cringe at how real they seem. A must-watch for any budding comedy junkie.

Best in Show is cleverly funny --- and I laugh every time I see it.  I've watched it often and find new delights every time I see it.  In other words, it wears well.  Not a blockbuster at all, but so, so much better than any blockbuster I know about --- except perhaps the Lord of the Ring movies.  Best in Show is funny in expected and unexpected ways.  Don't miss it.

Best In Show ridicules the extent dog lovers will go to extoll the virtues of their trophy dogs. As show dogs, they are clipped, coiffed
and coddled in an effort to outdistance the competition and secure the ribbon or trophy the owner covets that will convince the rest
of us that they are special. No method is out of line in giving their canine the edge as back-stabbing owners grapple for best of show.
Fred Willard is priceless as the judge who belittles the breeds. Eugene Levy shines as the clueless twit whose wife obsesses over
their pooches' chances. Great fun. Don't miss it.
One of my all time favorites! If you love dogs (or think dog lovers are crazy), this movie will have you in stitches.

The writing, the improvising, the acting--an extraordinary ensemble cast and lots of puppies thrown in to make it perfect. There's virtually not a moment of this movie that isn't exactly as wonderful as can be. It's not as crazy and cult-making as Spinal Tap, but it's such a funny, endearing, brilliant group effort. My wife and I love this movie and we watch it several times during the course of a year, probably once a month on average. It is very funny and has two of my favorite comedic actors from the old SCTV show, which I also loved. Catherine O'Hara and Eugene Levy are wonderfully funny as Gerry and Cookie Fleck and Fred Willard, who is always hilarious in anything he does is fantastic as the colorful host of the Mayflower Dog Show. As far as I am concerned, this satirical look behind the scene of this fictional event is well crafted, well acted and extremely funny. I must mention how funny Larry Miller is as one of Cookie Fleck's old flames. This really is a must watch movie for anyone who enjoyed SCTV, or This is Spinal Tap.

Or maybe it is Silliest Doggiefied!  Characters all!  Start of the movie is an interview process and gets you into the backgrounds of the weirdos who will all be showing their dogs.  Can't give it five, since it is so light.  A flighty distraction for a rainy, cold day.
I thought this movie was hilarious and would recommend for anyone who has a dog, loves dogs or watches the kennel club shows.

This movie is absolutely hilarious.  A great hit that I can watch over and over again.  I am a huge animal lover and own three cats and a dog of my own...they are my babies...my children.  I can totally relate to these crazy animal parents on this movie, however they go a bit beyond the norm when it comes to loving their animals.  Not to say that that is a bad thing...it's just so funny.  You've got to watch it!!

This movie came out in 2000 and was one of those movies that I'd "always meant to see" - I've just now watched it 14 years later with my Roku thanks to my Amazon Prime membership. Very funny, loved the ongoing themes throughout the movie, and really enjoyed seeing so many actors that recognized, and have enjoyed in other movies and tv shows over the years. May not be for everyone, but has a lot of the "kind" of humor that makes me laugh. Fred Willard's character questioning the familiarity of Catherine O'Hara's character killed me, and so much more - check this one out. *And this was reviewed by her husband Dave ;P
The movie was okay.  There wasn't any real plot. I viewed moved as a way to teach my son about dogs and having one for a pet.

Love the characters, love the actors, but the documentary "in their face" style was a little off-putting for an entire movie.  Kudos to the Weimeraner who kept his cool while the two actors went nuts around him.
awkwardly funny the entire time.  like a car wreck that you can't look away from.  good movie for some laughs.
I would recommend this to anyone. Funny witty never a dull moment (even when harlan pepper is just naming nuts)

Best in Show is better than any anti-depressant on the market!

Seen it several times and always laugh.

Quirky but talented cast in a series of skits somehow wrapped into a wonderful movie.
Anyone who's we ever been to a dog show, or family who shows, KNOW how truly neurotic people at shows can be! Spot on!
A laugh out loud, forget everything else kind of movie.  Forget about the dogs, watching the humans is the real show.

Since I don't think these reviews/ratings were meant to serve as a movie review, and I am not a movie critic, I will refrain from commenting on the actual film.
The DVD was exactly as described, with all the features mentioned in the description.  When a product and purchase experience are exactly as advertised, that warrants a 5-star rating regardless of the content.  :)
We both like to talk and not talk. Seen a lot of dogs today? There's plenty of them here in the lobby.
Funny subtle humor. It does center around a dog show, but it's really about the lives of the dog owners.
The plot is a bit lame and the acting is very much overdone.  I will not view it again. Thanks anyway.
One of the greatest shows ever. Seems to get more funny every time I watch.  Reviews take a lot of words...
Great and spectacular movie to watch with a family. Have seen this movie multiple times and always enjoyed it very much
Found it to be a poorly done movie slow start and crude not what I expected was a waste of $3.00
Seems every time a "dog show" is broadcast on television I want to watch this movie. Great for dog lovers!

My wife and I love this movie.  It is basically a freak show of different strange personalities with a dog show as the glue between the freaks.

I can't rate it high because I think most people won't like it.
fun to watch nothing great. I just wanted to see some more jane lynch material good commedy no academy award
Great cast, funny story, and very realistic view of the Dog Show world.  Typical Christopher Guest movie.  Worth watching once per year during Westminster.
Well-made, humorus movie. If you like dogs and dog shows it is very funny. I recommend this to adults that like dogs, would rent again, and hope this helps someone.
classic comedy, great for those days where you want to sit back and watch something funny. the characters are all classics. looks at that cast - amazing.
The movie is funny and wacky!  Nice, light entertainment.  If you saw the movie, Bernie with Jack Black, and you enjoyed it, this is a movie for you!
I found this movie to be just the right one to watch when just resting and relaxing.  No big thrills.  Just generally enjoyable.
If you have ever shown an animal, this is a must see. Great cast of characters. Keep in mind this is a spoof on dog shows.
Good satirical look behind the scenes look at dog shows and the dog owners. Strong cast of characters. Very funny.

If you have ever watched the famed Westminster Dog Show, you would swear this is a documentary.  The amazing ability of this talented cast brings this mocumentary to life.  Their improvisational training and commitment to character welcomes you into their lives and cracks you up in the meantime.

FUN!!

Just watched.....first time in a while.  So FUNNY!!
So many funny lines. Great for all audiences!!
Enjoy it again, today!
A true classic, even our teenage kids were cracking up.  One to be watched multiple times to relish some of the lines....one of our favorites!
Very funny movie. Great actors. Shows how people can be in real life. Recommend to all who have a great scents of humor.

this is a wonderfully  funny movie about people who become obsessed about dogs and lose perspective while doing so
No one gets beaten up or killed .We need more of this type made !
This great cast of characters in Best in Show always puts on a great performance. Christopher Guest is a comedic master.
A completely ridiculous and utterly satisfying movie. Every character is a magical example of what actors can do when they are allowed to act!

Best In Show is one of my favorite movies.  Great acting, adorable dogs and a hilarious depiction of what dog shows (and horse show) can be like. I could watch it 20 times and still be forced to laugh out loud :-).
Funny!  Great ensemble cast that know their craft well!  A not to be missed Comedy!  You won't regret watching this one!
It's just smart and funny. Classic Christopher Guest & anything with Jeniffer Coolige is good. Note the classic NYC gay couple, I love them.
It was ok not the worst nor the best movie ever. Some parts really made me laugh but the rest was dumb

Best In Show is one of those films that I enjoy watching a half-dozen times. Centered around a most prestigious pure-bred dog show, there are five very distinct owners with five very distinct canines.  Catherine O'Hara and Eugene Levy are the main story line - Catherine's promiscuous past coming up constantly to the consternation of Levy's ultimate geek character. The other contenders are an affluent gay couple, a Southern fishing shop owner (with his trusty Bloodhound), a busty trophy wife (continuously sought after by her lesbian dog trainer) married to a much-senior husband and lastly, a yuppie self-absorbed couple always on the verge of anxiety attacks.  There's enough quirkiness and funny lines for everyone, including Fred Willard's show announcer crazy statements and questions of the staid British color commentator.  If you're a dog lover, it's even better.  Enjoy, relax and laugh.

An average of 3.5, so I'll round up. This movie is hysterically funny. It never seems to get old. I would say the cast is full of some of the best improv comedy actors around. Great, great movie.

The quality of this Blu Ray, however, does not cut it. I'd recommend buying the DVD because this did not translate well to HD video.
The characters are actually fairly typical of folks in the dog, horse, cat...you name it ....shows...lots of fun to watch
I first purchased this film on VHS and have now worn out the tape.  Best in Show has an all star comedy cast that will leave you laughing the whole way through.
if you own a dog you will enjoy this. Eugene Levy is one of the funniest actors on the planet.
Funny but bad acting. Dogs were perfect of course. Story line was really cute and these handlers do go a bit overboard in real life.

If u need a good laugh then this is your movie. My wife have seen this movie with friends and just us and we always find something funny every time we missed the times before. there are several scenes that cause bust-out laughs.

The actors are well matched for the characters they play, the scripts are well written and the scenes are awesome. This movie always leaves us feeling good.
This is a very quirky funny movie-was perfect when I needed a laugh.  Would recommend when you are looking for something a little different.

The subject matter is not for kids, but everything else is mucho fab!!! And the dogs are incredible.  I went out and had my Chow and Japanese Akita to watch the movie with me! (LOL)  They loved it too!

This movie takes a group of extreme dogs enthusiasts and put them/their dogs in the biggest dog show competition. The relationships between dogs/owners and the narration of Fred Willard as the competition's "color" commentator are hilarious. Would definitely watch several times again whenever I need to laugh.
One of our family's favorites. Watched by us many times and just as funny each time we watch it. If you love dogs this is definitely a must watch.
Excellent cast! These spoofs always make me laugh my head off and this one was better than most. Over the top funny.
Have watched this movie many many times. Still love it. Hysterical, cast is amazing, as funny today as it was the first time.
This is one of my favorite movies of all time. If you haven't seen it, its it worth the watch. Everytime I see it it gets funnier
We stopped watching about half way.  It just made no sense.  There were a few funny parts, but overall it was just dumb.  However, humor is a subjective thing, you might like it.
Movie was very funny and enjoyable for entire family.  Reminded us of the old Vacation and Caddy Shack comedies.  A great satire of the Dog Show scene.
I love this movie and it gets funnier with each watching, though that's my quirky sense of humor.  It's a mock documentary with some over the top stereotyping, but nothing too hurtful.
Could watch this movie over and over. The best part about Christopher Guest is while he's having fun with the subject matter you could tell he also has great affection for those he lampoons.

One of funniest movies ever.  Eugene Levy, Parker Posey et. al are hysterical in this Christopher guest movie.  I've seen it several times.  It's especially fun to watch after seeing the Westminster Dog Show on tv.

If you have ever watched dog shows and loved the dogs but found the people hysterically amusing, you'll love this movie.  All the human eccentricities are over the top. and almost cartoonish until you recall the last real dog show you watched.  It's just a fun movie.
This is a really funny movie. The cast is great,  This movie is all ad lib no script. Best comedy ever!!
One of my favorite movies of all times. Most people I know who have seen this love it whether you are a dog lover or not.

I was disappointed in this comedy.  I watched it till the end thinking, this has got to get better, but it never did.  It especially got worse the more I watched it.  I get enough of the gay life style on the box we use to call TV.,  should now be called our brain washing machine.  I'm not a hateful person, I just don't agree with showing the affections of same sex partners in any capacity to the young. We should clean up the airways between man and women, men and men, women and women, all of it has gone way beyond disgusting.

It has its funny moments but in the end is very strange, almost like weird situational humor. I ended up playing on my phone through part of it. Some scenes are just plain weird and painful to watch. It isn't a bad movie, I guess you could say that it is just OK.

This, in my opinion, is the best offering from Christopher Guest & Co. Understated humor, great characters. The actors are at their best in this spoof, each of them in the best role to showcase his or her talents. The Parker Posey-Michael Hitchcock scenes can be a little grating, as they shout a lot, but it makes the end payoff that much funnier. The movie has enough layers warrant multiple viewings. Good stuff!
A humorous and subtle satire on owners and their dogs. Great acting and dialogue that will have you in stitches laughing. Even if you don't like dogs [but cats], it is just funny to watch.
In my opinion this is the best of all Christopher Guest's brilliantly funny films.  For dog lovers, it's a must!

The in jokes are endless on this one, the gang from a mighty wind returns for another jab at a subculture. This time it is the world of dog showing. Once again the crude humor abounds in this movie as a warning to those who might watch it as a family. Defiantly worth a watch.
This movie was actually boring. There were a few good scenes, and the characters sometimes interesting, but not worth the time spent watching it.

If you love dogs ... don't waste your time (or money) with this movie. It will just disappoint & frustrate you. The dogs in the movie looked bored & stressed. Poorly acted, bad script, and definitely NOT family friendly. As spouse commented when over... "Well, that was stupid AND stressful".
Great movie! Lots of funny stories of people and their dogs entering dog shows. Characters are over the top crazy!
We still enjoy watching this movie. Very cheeky/sarcasm about dog owners and dog shows with hilarious stereotypes. Obviously a little dated but still makes me laugh.

The script in this film accomplishes the most daunting of challenges, complexity of character, and uproarious humor. I have seen this film at least a half dozen times, and I still see something new and hilarious every time I watch.
For me, this is one of those movies I buy so I can watch it any time I want to.  Seems no matter how many times I've seen it, its always fresh, funny, and can give me a lift.  A classic!
We have a weird sense of humor. This is slapstick humor. Some content not good for children under 13 due to sexual innuendos. Great for older teens & adults.
not a good movie, don't know how it got 4 stars. ridiculous and no plot or rhyme or reason to it.

I use to show dogs so although I missed this movie in the theaters I wanted to see it - everyone said it was super funny - a real hoot!! Maybe because I am from the dog show world - my expectation's were set to high??? it was okay, yes I laughed a few times and I may watch it again sometime. Thank-you, Cheryl Lomonaco

p.s. I have actually shown under one of the judges in the movie....
Christopher Guest and his ensemble cast have created a comedy masterpiece.  Fred Willard is particularly good as the announcer who does not have a clue what's going on.  This is one not to be missed.
Maybe if I had gotten through the first 10 mins. my rating would have improved. I just couldn't get past the guy with two left feet.

Another Christopher Guest Gem. Very Funny. Very Smart. Eugene Levy is always so good and so is Catherine O'Hara. The whole cast is great. Admittedly, not everyone will enjoy this humor. Dogs, Dog Shows and the People who love them. A mockcumentary..
Cast is phenomenal!  The script is great - dry humor.  Made me want to buy tickets to a dog show.

I watched this after seeing it recommended on someone's top 100 movies list.  I'm so glad I took the time to watch it.  This isn't your slapstick, laugh track 3 Stooges funny.  Nor is it your raunchy Hangover/American Pie type of comedy either.  The comedic style of Christopher Guest is almost subtle--I don't think he was going for knee slapping funny (although there are definitely scenes where I was laughing a good while!).  I saw one review that said the announcer was too obnoxious--have you ever seen a dog show before!? This is a satirical take on dog shows by showing the almost extreme sides of humans (foils of the 2 gay guys and Jerry/Cookie--loved it)....and I loved how each dog mirrored their owners' personality.  I would absolutely recommend this to anyone.  If you're wondering what you'll be getting into...this type of comedy falls along the lines of The Office with the mockumentary style and the awkward, sometimes cringe-worthy humor and downright human moments.
After watching the show I realized how dumb it was.  It just wasn't what I expected it would be.  I wouldn't recommend it at all.

This is a really funny movie!!!  It has a wonderful and unique cast, with really funny story lines. I like that it is something unique, not just a cookie cutter comedy.  If you want a good laugh for a couple of hours it is well worth a view.
Should be in the library of all Christopher Guest fans as well as for everyone with an irreverent sense of humor.  Thoroughly enjoyed it..
Even though this movie got good reviews, I don't understand why.  I guess you have to see if and judge for yourself.  I did not like it and gave it away.

This is the 2nd movie I have watched through Prime and each time I only got 3/4 of the way through the movie when an error occurred preventing me from viewing the balance of the movies the same day.  What gives???  I had to finish each movie the next day and it started from the beginning and would not resume from the 3/4 mark. THIS SERVICE IS POOR AT BEST...  FIX IT NOW.
...is best in show! What a delightful movie this is...droll, dry, and laugh out loud! I'm currently watching it for the second time. I would highly recommend this movie to everyone. Have fun!
We have watched this movie over and over again. Never get tired of it. It is hilarious! Now we own a bloodhound!
Wonderfully fabulous cast, great characters and very funny stories. I could watch this over and over (and I have many times).
Pretty predictable and boring comedy. Tons of cliched dialogue and banter. Not sure why I made it all the way through ...
my daughter is a dog lover with a great sence of humor, she laughted a lot and shows it to her friends a lot
This is a classic comedy with terrific comedic actors. I loved it and would watch it again. Lots of laughs in this funny film.
Started out stupid and didn't look like it would improve from there.  Did not get far before I closed and deleted from my que list.

When my family gathers each Christmas we have a tradition now of watching this hilarious movie. I loaned my copy to someone and didn't get it back so had to have another copy in my library. It's a classic!
Funny movie with a great cast. Don't have to be a dog lover to enjoy this movie. Will watch again.
What a surprise. This is funny from beginning to end. The stereotypes are all over the top. You have good guys bad guy and everything in between.
Great mocumentary based in improvisation and based on dog shows such as the Westminster. All the usual Cristopher Guest buddies. Hilariious! Loved it!
Their was too much foolishness and not enough serious theme for the the show. a little more reality of the dogs would have helped and the announcer was terrible.
I found the movie to be far fetched and silly.  Liked the dogs but not so much the story.  I would not recommend this movie.
One the best comedy movies of all time. Mockumentary at it's best. Amazing cast. Everyone must see and own a copy.
It was a light comedy that helped pass the time on a recent trip.  If you like dogs, you will see what the dog show routine is like (or at least a parody of it).

Best in Show is a little more accessible, and certainly funnier, than Waiting for Guffman (admittedly a very funny movie), A Mighty Wind, or For Your Consideration, the other ensemble movies directed by Christopher Guest, post Spinal Tap. Eugene Levy, Catherine O'Hara, Larry Miller, Michael McKean, Parker Posey, Ed Begley Jr., Fred Willard, et al, make their usual appearances, but with better lines.

This movie moves slowly and feels more like a documentary about the world of dog shows. It depicts those dog owners as totally out of touch with reality and will leave you feel silly if you are one of them.
The dogs were cute but that's where it ended. Story was a bit slow. The acting was pretty good.  Not my favorite.
I made it about half way through the movie...I didn't find it funny at all :/  Nothing about it was funny to me ....
I am glad I don't know characters like the ones in this movie.  The dogs were the only redeeming quality.

Christopher Guest does it again with a brilliant ensemble cast and a story that is funny and unique. Who would think that a movie about a national dog show would have any interest to anyone outside of dog afficiandos? Well, with a cast like this, which includes some of the funniest people around, you quickly become engrossed in each sub-story and the overall plot. A very funny movie.
I love dogs and have shown dogs, so this movie hit home with me.  I have suggested this to friends.
A bit all-over-the-place but some of it is genuinely funny.  This might be a good show to watch while high.
Great cast, great acting, great screenplay...this one will have you rolling on the floor in laughter. Highly recommended for all.

Excellent movie. Best yet.  Have always loved movies and music. This is the best!
Thanks You always for giving me this.
Very broad humor.
This cast is brilliant & parts well played- very funny. And add the crazy world of showing dogs = great combo.
Very funny and light. Good film for adults, perhaps not right for children. A perfect cast dogs included.  Enjoy it
I have not watched this movie in years.  I forgot just how funny this movie is.  If you love dogs you will appreciate this movie.
Hilarious movie about the world of show dogs. Performances are spot on. Great behind the scenes view of Westminister type dog show.
Love it because most of the material is improvisation. I could totally watch that movie over and over and over again.

One of the classic parody movies.  Timeless visual gags...like the 4 clocks on the back wall of the hotel check-in desks...all with the same time showing.  Many, many more laugh moments not soon forgotten.
Easily one of my favorite comedies. This and Waiting for Gufman are both "therapy" movies for me because they are so silly but totally believable at the same time.
Such a fun movie! Classic Pure Chris Guest fare- super talented cast, impeccible comedic timing, funny even with several viewings. My family and I have watched this classic many times over the years.

This is a great ensemble cast movie from Christopher Guest. It is still very funny, and ground breaking. If you like shows like The Office, Parks and Rec, or Community, then you'll love this. This was doing the mockumentary long before this guys ever even thought of that concept. Even our dogs love this.
This is one of the all time BEST spoofs of inside the world of dog shows!  It's definitely the people!!

Funny.
Love dogs, but not like this.  These characters were definitely over-the-top.  And they rounded up quite a cast.
Good for some laughs.
This is a laugh-a-minute movie especially if you like dogs, dog shows and good character acting.  Highly recommended to lift your spirits!
a good comedy for someone who wants decent laughs with out the gross out pranks other films offer two thumbs up
Seriously, see it. Still one of the funniest movies my family has ever seen. If you own a dog especially.
tired of watching "comedy" about dysfunctional people - it's the same old story line over and over just with different backdrop.  BORING.
If you liked "This Is Spinal Tap" then, you'll like this now.  Also check the same essential cast in "A Mighty Wind".

I enjoyed A Mighty Wind, but this one never got off the ground. Tried to watch it with my son and he asked me to turn it off... Nothing but un-funny sexual innuendos and potty humor. There was some of that in A Mighty Wind, but here it just became unwatchable. I expected better from such a great cast.
We love Christopher Guest movies.  We were very happy to see that this one is standing the test of time.  It is still as funny as we remembered.
Hilarious Satire of dog show world with all star cast! Great mix of excellent characters and of course dogs! Who doesn't love dogs?
I am a big fan of Christopher Guest and "Best in Show" is my favorite by him. All of the characters are over the top.
The humor was buried under the social commentary.  Maybe the ending wrapped up the story.  We didn't bother to watch that long.

So many very interesting characters - all absolutely believable.
All dog lovers will laugh at this - and even the few people that do
not like dogs - will enjoy the bizarre bahaviour of the characters.

Nice change to find a totally engrossing movie that does not
include cars exploding and murder.

This is a classic comedy!! All of the performances are inspired but the stand out is the great Jennifer Coolidge. Why isn't she getting more roles?? She's right up there with Madeline Kahn...She definitely was the 'Best' in 'Show'
Best in Show is one of my all time favorite flicks! It's witty, charming, and has an all star cast!
Could not get into this movie and I love dogs...gave up on it and turned it off the beginning was a slow start

It is honestly just a great movie. It shows different extreme stereotypes that seem like they were picked to match their dog breeds. Just hilarious. There's a lot of awkward, lewd humor in it, so I suggest not watching it with a parent or something like that, but it was good.
I have given copies of this to everyone I know - I am like a kid when I watch it . . .again and again and again and each time it gets funnier (I'm 70 years old!)

From the dog show schedule come five sets of dog owners. And, what a crazy group. The young couple who are afraid their sex life is making their dog depressed enough to need a psychiatrist; the midwest couple who raise their own small town terrior champion & find themselves in the National Madison Square Garden Dog Show; the gay couple who take their pampered pooches and their fancy wardrobes & wall hangings to decorate their hotel room; the Southern hometown man with his champion bloodhound and his old hunting trailor; and the spoiled rich woman with her 70 year-old husband and her fancy poodle with its very well-paid handler. When the real dog show finally begins, the laughs keep coming. Who ends up winning Best in Show? If you are a dog lover or just love comedy, you will enjoy watching "Best in Show"!
For everyone who loves dogs and eccentric people, this one is definitely a hit!  Be prepared to laugh out loud.
Always a go to movie when you need a good laugh. The actors are so good too! Enjoy Best in Show!
A mildly pleasant way to while away an hour and a half. Interesting concept to dress a spoof as a documentary, some good characterizations and funny situations.
The movie has stood the test of time. It's still very funny all the way through. Fred Willard is hilarious

This is such a funny movie. Very dry, great humor. You don't know what to think when you just start the movie, but you will soon realize it's hilarious. A very fun movie showing dogs and their owners. Even though you wouldn't want to admit it after watching this, as a dog owner you will recognize things you have or do just like the characters in the movie.
I love dog shows and was told I should see this.  I did.  It was entertaining.  I suspect that although it was exaggerated, it is probably more truth than fiction.
I have watched this movie so many times it should get about 50 stars. It is truly funny and cracks me up every time I watch it. Good quality movies from the seller. Very happy with the movies.
What was this?  Perhaps it was meant to be a documentary with exquisitley  poor acting. This Certainly is not a comedy.
Very funny. Well written and acted. Like the older movies and will watch more. I recommend this movie for some leisure watching.
Whether you like dogs or not, this is the funniest movie ever! The acting is priceless and the cast is quite comedic. A movie I can watch over and over and always laugh
there is a reason this film is not free, why it's a constant pay per view, it's one of the best comedies of all time
funny movie. Well written. I've seen it about 10 times, & I plan to watch it at least10 more times.
Layer upon layer of humor combined with a great cast makes this mockumentary one of the best of its kind.
This is a movie for dog lovers or lovers of dog lovers.  It is funny in a quirky sort of way.

Definitely a must watch if you have a warped sense of humor and you like dogs.  The guy with 2 left feet is hysterical.  We gave this to our 60ish parents and they loved it as well.  Most adults would enjoy.
Again a timeless movie that brings back fond memories.  My daughters watched with me and now are hooked as well.
This movie is a must for anyone who liked "Waiting for Guffman", or "A Mighty Wind". It's the kind of dry comedy awkward comedy that Christopher Guest is so damn good at expressing. Classic.
This movie really takes a serious.. ok no not serious, hilarious look at the world of dog shows.  It was exciting to see the different breeds but more so the hilarious antics.
These guys are genius at picking up traits.  I have been involved in showing for 20 years and this movie is shockingly accurate and hilarious.

This movie just makes me bust out laughing!!  It is dog lovers OVER THE TOP!
They are definitely poking fun at themselves and it is laugh out loud funny.
It's done in the "documentary" style which is a nice change of pace too.
so very funny and well written...Love all of Guest's movies! They are not to be missed for sure! Great entertainment!
My favorite scene is Parker Posey coming unglued looking for her dog's missing "busy bee" toy!  She is brilliant!  Highly recommend for a good, hard laugh.
Stellar cast and too funny. Definitely worth a watch! All of the Christopher Guest movies are great though and this one is no different.
One of my favorites.....characters so well developed....don't we all know folks who act like this with their animals? A laugh a minute.
One of my all time favorites.  Funny thought the movie.  Watch every Xmas by request from our family and friends
Best in Show has been a famiy favorite since our initial viewing 13 years ago.  We are all dressing as BiS characters for our family New Year's party this year.  Enough said!
Hilarious fun. Love this movie. Wish A Mighty Wind was more popular. Good time movie that is just fun to watch.
a good movie , kids might not find it as funny as adults but it's still a nice gem that you will enjoy. :)
I like this movie because the humor is so random, that it might just be real. The characters are funny, and the story comes full circle
If nothing else is on this would fill some time. Low class characters are developed by making them do the worst high school antics.
Hilarious!  This is my husbands favorite show! So I'm buying it for him for Christmas so he can watch it when he wants!

This show is so funny! I can put it on anytime I'm feeling down & I'm laughing before I know it! If you have ever watched a real dog show you will get a kick out of the clever way they poke fun of the people that take showing dogs as a way of life. Always good for a laugh!

This is one of my favorite movies. It gets funnier everytime I see it. The cast is amazing, so believable. I can only imagine the laughter while they were filming, it's a wonder they get through those lines.
It's quirky, the humor is subtle. I'd recommend it to everyone even if they are dog lovers.

I had heard that this movie was hilarious so I bought it. Stride to watch it last night and got bored and switched over to the news. Maybe it was the filming style with all the interviews, but it was annoying. Would not recommend.
Thought that a show with dogs might be funny. I was wrong. Watch only if you have nothing else to watch
This movie is a little wacky, but very, very fun to watch!  You have to really appreciate the silliness to enjoy, but it's fun!

This movie is my favorite "mockumentary" of all time! The characters are so perfect and relatable! (I think we've all known a neurotic dig owner that projects their feelings onto the dog). The story is well written and hilarious!
Cats are cool but dogs rule! and the people who love both types are more grounded.  Having something to love is soothing.
This parody is so spot on.  Even my teen loved it.  This was my 4rth time watching it. Another hit by Sir Christopher Guest.

Extremely witty, captures the nature of dog shows.  Cleverly parodies the dog owners.  Just loads of laughs, fun and entertaining.
I could watch it over and over.
Great send up of the uber serious pet show crowd. Cast of ex-SNL and 2nd city players putting in nice performance as essentially straight man roles.
I love this movie and no matter how many times I watch it I laugh. Very good characterizations from some very good actors.
This movie is FANTASTIC!!  I have seen it many times, but wanted to own it! Now I can watch it any time, over and over! It is hilarious......a classic for sure!
This is one of the funniest movies I have ever seen.  Everyone should have a copy to watch when they are feeling blue.
the best movie....a must have cult classic for any collectors video collection.  Very funny look at dog shows. A whos who among 2nd city comedians.
This movie is a must for any fans of spoof movies. Cookie and Loopie are hysterical as the owners of a prize winning Mr. Winkie.
Wow, really. Slow movie. Only a couple parts made me laugh. Can't believe I watched the whole thing, since I can't even remember which dog won.
Cleverly satirical, with a charmingly diverse cast of characters and jokes both obvious and subtle. Whatever your favorite kind of humor, you will find it here.
Funny Movie ! Based on folks showing dogs, it had some really funny charters and high points  !  One of Fred Willard's BEST performances.. A real screwball character and some funny lines !
If you love dogs & enjoy character studies and you have a sharp sense of humor, you will thoroughly enjoy this movie!
Great little movie if you like understated and dry humor.  Fred Williard is especially funny as well as Eugene Levy.
One of the funniest movies of all times.  I laugh out loud every time I see it.  One character is funnier than the other, and how could you not love them all!
Was very boring-very immature humor-Turned movie off after 30 minutes-The plot line took far too long to develop and by the time the characters were developed, we lost interest

Beyond stupid.  I kept watching it, expecting it to get better based on the cast.  It never did.  Slow moving with very poor plot development.  It isn't even a good spoof on dog shows.  Don't waste your time.
A great satire on dog show participants and their devotion to their dogs.  It is sassy, brilliant and has a cast that is flawless. Great fun!
Just the funniest movie. If you like stereotype characters, this is for you. You have to watch it a few times. I always catch another funny part when I watch it again.
hilarious....great fun....easy to digest.  want to know what happens behind the scenes oat this type event.....it's funny and fun! Watch it, you'll like it!
some funny things but unless you're really into dugs it might be boring like it was for me. Fast forward solved it.

Kind of a silly movie, but for a dog show person, it is amusing to watch. I don't know if non-dog show people would really get it.... but we can watch it and laugh at it and also compare it to other people we know.
This is a great movie and I was happy to get it. This was just as described and  came in record time
They've really captured the range of personalities on the dog show circuit.  I see myself and others in almost every one of these characters!
Hilarious!  One of my daughter and mine favorites!  When we talk,  as she is back East, we usually end up saying little quips from the movie.

I really enjoyed this movie. It's not for everyone, as the humor is offbeat and...odd, to say the least. But I thought it was hilarious. Good movie for a Friday night at the end of a long work week. The people are fun and quirky, and they take their dogs VERY seriously.
One of my favorite movies, always good for a laugh. I can't believe how many people have not seen this movie.
There's a lot of funny parts but the movie is wrecked by all the sexual innuendos.  We didn't finish it because of that.
Hilarious!! Oldie but goodie. Sctv comic mocimemtary on dog shows is very funny. There are a few more in the series. Also funny.
Still one of the best ensemble movies around!!! I watch this over and over and laugh every time! Fred Willard is a hoot! See this one!
Amusing story that is well acted and reflects the personalities and eccentric interplay between pets and their weird but wonderful owners.
Great writing and acting.  Especially fun for dog lovers. It's got several stories in one, about several dog owners all headed to the same dog show.
Why did anyone think this was funny? It's horrible and there are so many stories going on that you can't follow it. We didn't even finish watching it.
Was not as funny as everyone had told me it was, boring if you are not into Dog Shows. Being an old movie I will not consider this a classic!
This movie incorporates a little slapstick with just plain humor. The actors are perfect for their parts. It pokes fun at straight laced dog show.
HAVE SEARCHED FOR THIS CLASSIC  MOVIE FOREVER IN THE SHOPS ..WATCHING IT NOW  SOON AS I GOT IT OUT OF THE BOX...THANKYOU AMAZON
Entertaining, good satire.  If you raise show dogs you might not enjoy this movie.  If you like good satire, this could be the movie for you.

Too bad there isn't a short film about Parker Posey and her husband catalogue shopping - this is my favorite Parker Posey performance because her agony is so entertaining.

This is also my favorite Christopher Guest film - the only one that I like unreservedly with not much fast forwarding over boring sections.

So funny to tell the truth I showed dogs for a while and its so close to the truth it squeaks. Every time I look at it I just laugh and shake my head and realize that oh my goodness I must have looked like that to the pet people.  So much fun. A really must see picture.
Acting was good, I guess.  It was crazy but not that funny.  Maybe it was better in a movie theater with friends.

I'm not saying this is a bad show, but that you should check first if it's a style of humor you will enjoy.

Naturally there are many styles of humor. Example, many people in the US have trouble following British humor and vice-versa. Some humor is broad slapstick, others narrow genre.

This show is very much the latter, narrow genre, stylized to specific tastes. As such, it will be hugely loved by some viewers and complete waste of time for others (as it was for me).

I learned however a great tip from this experience. Look up the most positive reviewers of a show, see what other shows those people like. If you share similar tastes, go for it. Otherwise don't.

If I'd crosschecked for similar tastes to fans of this show, I would have known to avoid it.  :-)

This movie is amazingly hilarious!  I can't imagine that anyone hasn't seen it yet, but just in case you haven't and you're wondering if the movie is any good, yes, yes it is!  I think It probably has more adult humor, so I would be careful about letting your kids watch it, but I laugh every single time I see it!  Give this one a shot!  Especially if you have Amazon Prime, you definitely can't go wrong with a free rental!

This movie spoofs pedigree dog owners who are participating in a national dog show. Each owner has his/her different, but hilarious idiosyncrasies which makes you think their dogs have a lot more intelligence than they do. For some reason, the announcer at the dog show is not familiar with the competition, which really adds some laughs. I bought this as a Christmas gift for a family member who hasn't seen it yet. I know he'll enjoy it as much as I did.
The kind of funny that jumps up and bites you! A hilarious satire of the dog show industry! A must see for anyone with a sense of humor!

When I originally saw this film, I was turned off. The humor is often superficial (two left feet?) and a little mundane. But like an old friend, everytime I watch it, I get a comfortable warm fuzzy feeling and see some things I missed. There's no denying the talent acting in this film. I think I enjoy most the culture commentary that is a running subtext regarding gold diggers, rednecks and others. It's great to imagine these as real people thrust together in an often ridiculous forum. With all their weirdness and odd dedication to impressing the judges, it really is fun to watch.
This team of actors if brilliant. If this movie doesn't make you smile, then there's something wrong with you. It's so unique and funny.

This was just bad - its hard to fathom just how bad this is.  After all I'd read reviews that said this was a great comedy.  I tried, I really tried to get into the characters. I know they were supposed to be caricatures and funny, but I just found them to be grating and annoying.  It seemed like the characters were written by mean spirited children showing us how smart they are through the idiocy of the characters they dreamed up.  And I was stunned at just how much they got on my nerves.  But all's well that ends well.  I am happy to report that I was able to find the "stop" button very quickly, and put an end to everyone's misery.
A classic improvisational comedy that follow ridiculous dog owners as they get ready for the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog (not even sure if this is a real contest).

If you have never understood dog shows, this film supposedly takes you behind the scenes of the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog Show in Philadelphia.  It takes the character of a documentary, but these are actors playing the roles of eccentric dog owners.  Remember the saying that after a while dog owners look like their dogs?  Well, there are some resemblances in this film.  Some of the dialogue is improvised.  It's quite amusing at times, but it helps to love dogs and put up with their owners. The owners are fairly neurotic - the dogs seem smarter.  Lots of goofy humor about dogs and their owners.  If you need something light and fun, you should enjoy this film if you like dogs.
This is very funny movie. All characters are perfect, even the dogs. I didn't see part two, I hope Amazon will get it soon.
Not that great of a movie....guess ti is all what you are looking for, but their are far better movies available to watch.
A classic comedy with an all-star cast.  Always laughing more and more each time I watch it!  Sheds a new light on dog shows!  :)
This is my favorite movie and has been for years. I never owned it on DVD though so I am excited that I now do!
I received the item quickly and it was packaged well. I would recommend this product. I love this movie & bought it for my mom who is a dog lover.
One of my favorites; great comedy and hits on some underlying truths in dog "parents", I never tire of watching this
Waited the whole movie for it to get better.  If I had paid to watch this movie I would have to DEMAND my money returned.  They should pay people to watch it..
I'm glad I found this wonderful movie!  Such hysterical nuances throughout, my wife and I will watch is yearly, along with Wizard of Oz.
Someone mentioned this movie & went looking for it. I watch dogs P/T now, and found it extra funny since some dog people are a little over zealous to say the least.
Every time a gem. Hadn't watched this for awhile, and wondered if it would still amuse me as it had. It did!

Best acting I have seen in a very long time.

Best directing and story telling.

This movie showed the slightly extreme lives of Dog Show participants.  The actors were great in their almost
Saturday Night Live like performances.

The acting had an almost adlib quality, but you know that that each line was carefully crafted and flawlessly performed.

Great Job.  Cant wait to see the other 2 follow on movies.
A tongue in cheek poke at the world of doggie beauty pageants, full of memorable characters and off the wall humor
Funny, funny, funny movie.  I just love it.  I've watched it a dozen or more times & it's still funny!.

"Best in Show" gets five stars for one reason: Fred Willard. As the obtuse, boorish announcer, Fred gets all the best lines, and he delivers them with gusto. The entire movie is just a lead-in for Willard's performance. Watch, be patient, and wait for Fred Willard. You won't be disappointed.
I laughed from beginning to end. The spoof/satire was dead on. I don't know how the actors kept a straight face in some of the scenes. Priceless!

This cast of characters is so RIGHT ON, this film nearly qualifies as a documentary. It's a gently comic, compassionate exaggeration of what you find in dog show culture, complete with unmentionable class and culture stratification. You will roll on the floor laughing. Totally worth an evening getting popcorn all over the couch cushions; excellent family viewing without dumbing down to tween sensibilities!
I love this movie! It has a strong cast and very dry humor. Great for a rainy winter afternoon snuggled on the couch with hot chocolate and popcorn.
some humor is dry, but this was like peanut butter. it just takes forever to get it off the roof of your mouth. it dragged, cute but dragged all the way through.
Great movie for any dog lover. Comedy still holds up 12 years out. Hope Beatrice ended up with a good home, you will too.
Very bad, on every level.

What's not to like.  Neurotic Dog Show attendees.  The best of the Christopher Guest movies.  I love showing this to people for the first time, it's great to watch my friends laugh.

You could use this as an acid test for dates, not sure if I would bother with anyone who didn't like it.

Great actors..It's like a B movie on steroids.
I call this type of movie "stupid funny". It's somewhat predictable but makes you laugh out loud while being just downright silly.
Such a well written funny clever movie.  Has always been a favorite.  Will likely be one of yours as well.

This is a fantastic movie, funny and surprising, sweet and weird, smart and unusual, from the folks who brought you Spinal Tap, Waiting for Guffman, and A Mighty Wind.  If you love comedy, if you love dogs, if you love poking holes in the pomposity of other people's obsessions, if you love nuanced character studies and insanity, this movie is for you.

Quirky human characters, eccentric dogs. Fun! We really enjoyed this movie as light entertainment. It's not enlightening, but just plain mindless fun.
One of my very favorites. It's funnier every time I see it. A must for dog lovers and people watchers. Caution: you will catch yourself quoting lines from this movie!

This is so close to real life.  I raise show dogs and I can tell you from my many dog owners that have shown their dogs, it takes all kinds.  This movie shows how far some owners go for their Show Dogs, it is crazy funny!

WE WATCH IT ALL THE TIME,,,,,,,CAN'T GET ENOUGH OF IT...LOVE ALL THE CHARACTERS

Best in show has non stop hilarity for me. the "serious" demeanor each actor brings to their roles is the key.  the dialogue is genius as it does reflect how we hear others and ourselves, if one is truthful. ridiculous but true in oh so many ways.

Hilarious parody of the dog show culture and the various types of people and dogs who participate, both directly and indirectly.
Am a huge fan of the "this is Spinal Tap" gang, and this one doesn't disappoint!  Great cast, all around!  I'd recommend to anyone who enjoys good spoof/ "mockumentary" theater .

this movie is unbelievable!  One of the dryest, funniest movies about a group of people that take themselves waaay to seriously!

This movie is a must for dog lovers! Great actors, and the humor is awesome! Every time I watch this movie I find something new to laugh at. It's a classic!

I love this movie, I watch it every couple of years.  A great gift to buy someone who has never seen it.  I definitely recommend this to anyone!  This is the best of the mockumentary movies made by this group.  Check it out!

This hilarious movie is a must see! You don't even have to be a dog owner to love this great movie!

This comedy, presented as a documentary, follows 5 dogs and their owners who have entered their dogs in a dog show in Philadelphia.  The dogs' humans are well defined, eccentric characters played by some of my favorite actors: Fred Willard, Jane Lynch, Jennifer Coolidge and Christopher Guest to name a few.
This movie startled out well, but it soon became tedious, with no coherent theme or story line ever developing.  It was more or less just a "slice of life" for dog show people.
I bought for my elderly friend (VHS) version.  We've watched it about 8 times together -- she has short term memory loss and I adore this movie.  Brilliant cast and the dogs are amazing.
Great acting all around. Tender subject matter for dog lovers. Both light hearted and serious all at the same time.

I love this movie, but was disappointed to see the DVD case broke on the bottom.  There was parts of the case floating in the encasement wrapping.  Most other packages I received from Amazon are carefully shipped & normally in larger boxes than what is even needed for the items purchased, but this was not shipped with the same care.  The packaging was thin & barely fit the actual DVD.
I watch this over and over again.  Wacko, silly, intelligent humor.  Good writing, nothing is sacred, definitely worth your viewing time.
The characters in this movie are hilarious.  All determined to win a major dog show.  If you like dogs, a bonus!
so many different characters.  A lot of veracity to this movie as it accurately portrays the competitiveness of people at a dog show.  Laugh out loud funny!
I kept thinking there was going to be a climax, a funny part...but instead it just droned on and on with the same tone of humor which was not all that funny...just not my idea of a comedy
