Like everyone says, go to a dog show and you'll find the characters there in one form or another.  Great movie.
It tried to hard to be funny with lame techniques. For instance one main character had literally two left feet.,  Ba dum dum. Slapstick humor. I was waiting for it to get funny  but it never happened
I had seen this at the movies, and am glad I saw it again with a friend who hadn't seen it. Wicked sense of humor.

I gave this movie 5 stars when I originally watched it many years ago and again feel just as thrilled about it.  Such fantastic premise, wonderful character development, excellent acting and great humor!  well done!

This movie is down right hilarious!! It has a cult following, and many of the actors have gone on to make it big. The creator has an off sense of humor I love because I can watch this over and over again.

I didn't realize at the time I was watching it that it was a movie created by totally adlibbing and there was no script. Someone pointed it out to me later. It was kind of corny at times but we liked it overall.

It makes me laugh out loud. Such a funny parody of the dog show world. We've all known people with these quirky traits no matter the venue. People who have dogs or are familiar with the show world will find this especially funny but almost anyone can find humor in the obsessive eccentricity of this star filled cast.
Makes me laugh-- and laugh --- and laugh!  Such super-stereotype characters  written so cleverly, with the perfect cast.  And beautiful dogs to look at!
Not funny at all. Just annoying and painful to watch.  I do not recommend watching this movie for any reason.
Of the Christopher Guest genre, Best in Show and Spinal Tap are my faves, by far. You might have to watch it a few times before it becomes completely hilarious to you...
Awkward... But funny. I watched it twice. The characters in the movie are all funny... And the announcer is hilarious.
This is one of those movies you can watch repeatedly and laugh at it every time.  A definite must see.
Excellent movie... if you own a dog you have to see it.  show dog circuit mockery.  laughed every minute of this movie.  Stifflers mom is in it (Jennifer Coolidge)

This is a very funny film, but riotous if you're familiar with the dog show world. Christopher Guest is the genius of ensemble comedy.  I've seen all of his and this is among the best. Saw it again just last week.  Guffman is the best, for those who haven't seen it.

Would highly recommend this movie to those that are either curious about the behind the scenes life of dog showing, or those that do show dogs as they will totally relate to either themselves or those around them.

Very tongue in cheek look at dog showing, was a bit flat in the delivery, but definately produced a few giggles from myself !

I am an extreme dog lover.  I live in the country and have rescued many dogs. This movie is hilarious.  I actually know people who act like the people in this film.  I could not stop laughing even when I watched it repeatedly.
This movie is hilarious. One of my family's favorites. This movie is for all ages that is if someone's not uptight.

I am stupefied, and perplexed, and also befuddled at the number of excellent reviews regarding Best in Show. Perhaps one must be "in on the joke" or stoned or a good friend of Larry Miller's to see in this film what I simply can't. This film starts out slow and gets slower real quick. This type of humor is a kind of esoteric, insider let's-say-every-word-with-exaggerated-obviousness funny, or at least the actors and the director seem to think so. It's really quite sad because there are actors and entertainers of great talent and comedic skill here. Eugene Levy, Christopher Guest, Michael Mckean, Fred Willard and oh heck let's even include Larry Miller as comedic actors I absolutely respect and admire. These are funny people, no question. And then there are actors that I absolutely revere for their accomplishments, like Bob Balaban, who I will always bow to for his first and very young, controversial role in Midnight Cowboy. And Ed Begley Jr. who also calls for and gets my great respect.

Then why, please tell me, why is it that this movie is so gosh darn un-funny? if the cast is loaded with talent then it can only be the writer, director and producer. Guest is a complete failure in this directorial effort. Another thumbs down to Eugene Levy who co-wrote this flop with Guest. I apologize for being so harsh but in all honesty I bought this DVD, paid somewhere around $10 including shipping, and felt taken. I felt bamboozled. In all honesty I, along with my daughter, could not even get through the entire film and turned it off after about an hour. My daughter and I have a running joke; when we say "best in show" we break up laughing because we both know that means horrible, self-indulgent movie. There it sits now, in my "never to be watched again" basket, where it will eventually go to a future garage sale for $1 or more likely the trash can.

Look, it's true that I am critical. However my scathing criticality is equally matched with my slobbering and generous praise when I experience the pleasure of watching a fine, or at least very entertaining, film. Condemn me if you will but I speak from the heart: this movie was an utter disappointment. I only wish there was a "zero stars" rating because Best in Show has earned it.

One of the funniest and cleverest of humorous films I've seen in recent years that happily avoids most of the adolescent nonsense that often passes for humor these days in the world of movie making. The technique used to inspire within a basic structure improvisation by the actors works beautifully here in my view.

I received the dvd but because it was from USA it had the wrong regional code.  And does not work on Australian DVD.  It should have been noted.

Do you want it back.
This is my favorite movie of all times! Plus, my dog is a Norwich Terrier! A must see for anybody with a great sense of humor!

This was supposed to be a very funny movie.  I've been to one big dog show and it's pretty realistic but not funny to me.  With all the great reviews, I expected to really like this.  Sure am glad it wasn't expensive.  Don't let little kids watch it due to nudity.  Pretty tacky in my opinion.  I'm almost always in the minority however.  If you're a very conservative person, I 'm guessing you would not like this but if you are of the mind set that anything goes, you will probably find it amusing.
The entire movie was in bad image quality.  Very grainy.  Plus the movie was not very funny.  Not my favorite.
when I need a good belly laugh I watch *Best In Show*....it depicts a comedic dog show, but in my opinion, it is a reality show too!!!!!!!!LOVE THIS MOVIE.....don't miss it!!!!!!!!!!
I've seen this 3 times and it's always a Great laugh. fun fun fun. Happy to own it and lend it to friends

i have always been a dog lover & once I saw this show, I knew I had to have a copy to share it with family & friends. We have had several enjoyable evenings filled with laughter watching it.
Gillian Macgregor, Gillitts, Durban, South Africa.

Good humor that can be enjoyed by anyone whoe has a dog, and is able to laugh not only at the movie, but laugh at themselves for dog lovers are all a bit eccentric.  Maybe we don't admit it, but we are all crazy.
If you like dogs and dog shows you will find this to be the most hilarious movie ever made. Bow-wow-wow, etc.
Shows the quirky people in the dog show business. Having been the owner of a show dog, I would say this takes the politics of the show, and the related characters and makes it super funny.
I got this through Amazon Prime streaming video.  It has a good quality picture and the movie is, of course, very funny.
This is one of my classic fun filled favorite movies!  I believe this is one of those Cult Surprises  that is a Must See. That is timeless!
Wonderful fun!  I highly recommend this film. It has it all for great entertainment. Good for a monthly watch!  YES!
Absolutely the funniest movie ever made. I would reccommend this to every one who is looking for a good laugh
it is so stupid I had to turn it off.  Couldn't take more than a few minutes.  It amazes me why anyone would make a movie like this.

That's pretty much what you need to know right there in the title. A film crew follows an oddball bunch of dog owners to the big show. A very talented group of actors on display as well as some great writing make this one funny flick.
This movie is a comical look at dog shows and a caricature of people who participate in them.  Funny and entertaining.  A few parts that aren't appropriate for the early teens.

Christopher Guest knows how to get the best from his company of improv geniuses. The comedy comes up and bites you and you are soon laughing and shaking your head and totally engaged in the lives of the silly people involved in the Mayflower Kennel Club Dog Show. The usual suspects are here: Eugene Levy, Catherine O'Hara, Michael McKean, John Michael Higgins, Parker Posey, Bob Balaban and Jennifer Coolidge. This film made Jane Lynch a star. I have seen BEST IN SHOW at least 30 times and still laugh. WAITING FOR GUFFMAN set the stage and BEST IN SHOW takes the baton and runs with it. A perfect mocumentary. As a fan of great comedy and a former student of improvisation, I can only bow in admiration for this great comedy team.
Clever writing and improvisation and great acting make this movie a favorite for me. I'll watch it again in a year or two.
I laugh in every scene of this movie.  Such talented actors and terrific writers!!  This was the first movie I ever downloaded from Amazon and will certainly do so again!

I have been looking for this movie..great value, and well worth it..I received the movie much sooner than I expected, with no issues at all..I would definitely recommend this seller to anybody, and I will return to this seller in the future
this movie is the kind of film I have in my library. Seen it several times and it never gets old.

One of the best mockumentaries i have ever seen.  The cast is brilliant and keeps you laughing to the last scene!
I recommend without hesitation.
Happy Viewing!
This could have been really funny but the trashy show announcer and the homosexual emphases made this not family friendly at all.
Best in Show was slow moving and insipid. It was very predictable. I felt it was not worth the time to watch it.
This movie is hilarious if you like dry humor. If you know dog lovers it seems so realistic and funny. I have seen it several times and each time it gets better.

I have seen this movie countless times, but was so pleased to see it on Amazon Prime where I could watch it for free while I was taking care of some other things around the house.  Regardless of how many times I have seen it, there are still always places where I stop whatever else I am doing to just laugh:  the butcher shop; the introduction of the MCs; saying good night to the other dogs at hom ... this whole franchise is just one of the funniest, smartest collecxtion of films ever, and I don't tire of any of them!

The movie is a great movie even if you don't love dogs the stereo types are just hilarious.
This is a fun movie the puns are fun and there are some great dogs to boot.

If you love dogs or at least know about dogs, you'll find this entertaining. I have no idea if you'll think it funny if you are somebody that shows and obsesses about your dogs' performance and appearance, though.
This movie is as charming as it is funny! A must see for dog lovers and everyone else alike!! The announcers steal the show!
If you like dry, awkward humor, this movie is for you.  The acting is superb and the character developmet is excellent.
Great movie!  So many great character actors. The announcer at the show steals every scene he is in. I'll retch this one several times.

Sweet, funny, a little naughty, something for everyone!

90 minutes I'm not begging some Hollywood director to give me back.
ONE OF THE MOST CLEVER VIDEOS EVER.  CHRISTOPHER GUEST IS A GENIUS! REMARKABLY FUNNY CAST, WELL DONE! A REAL CLASSIC.. LILLY

I loved this movie, and then I found out that it's self-scripted by the actors.  They were given their 'character selection' then asked to create dialog and even clothes and a 'look' to fit the character.  AWESOME... It's not only hilarious, but as you watch it you find yourself thinking OMG... I know someone just like this!

Funny in a chaotic way!!  I have animals so I can see how obnoxious I appear to others after watching this movie.

Love Jane Lynch.
I choose this rating for Best In Show because it was a cute film, funny but not too exciting. It would be good for older children to watch.

Best in Show is a classic. Of the Christopher Guest films, it is, in my opinion, by far the best. Every character is interesting and played perfectly by their respective actors. The laughs just do not stop and the whole production is so full of life and energy that I've been drawn to re-watching it several times, something quite rare for a comedy in my experience.
Delightful, gentle spoof of the dog show experience. A great film for all dog lovers, especially those who know little about showing dogs!  I highly recommend it.

'Best In Show' is one of those movies that you will be quoting 10 years after you see it the first time. It is the best of the Chrisotpher Guest ensemble movies since 'This is Spinal Tap'. I mean 'A Mighty Wind' and 'Waiting For Guffman' were good but not great...'Best In Show' is GREAT!

The movie follows multiple sets of people preparing and traveling to the country's biggest dog show. It mocks the ridiculous love affair some people have with their pets.

Some of the best quotes:

- "WHERE'S BUSY BEE? You run and you go get busy bee!"
- "Don't look at the fat ass losers or freaks, look at me! "
- "No, that's a bear in a, in a bee costume."
- "I was born with two left feet."
- "I'll gouge your right eye out with my thumb, I s*** you not, you little freak!"
- "And do me a favor, will you? Just get out one of those pepperoni sticks. I just wanna hold it."
- "We met at Starbucks. Not at the same Starbucks but we saw each other at different Starbucks across the street from each other.
- "Excuse me if this off the subject a little bit, but just take a guess at how much I can bench press. Come on, what do you think? Take a guess. 315 pounds!"

You can't find this kind of humor anywhere anymore. It is one of  my favorite comedies of all time.

Parker Posey in braces still makes me laugh to this day!
A classic movie that has something for everyone...everyone. everytime we've seen it we catch something silly we didn't see before.

MY family was poor, so the local big dog show was an outing we could enjoy together.  The spectacle of the gorgeous dogs and their outrageous handlers provided hours of free entertainment, plus we filled shopping bags full of free samples of dog food for the family mutt from all the vendors.  I still tune in for the Westminster coverage, and chuckle over the glorious absurdity of it all.  So I was predisposed to enjoy this movie, and I certainly did!  As if anyone needed another reason to make fun of lawyers!  That poor Weimeraner!  The bloodhound will snuffle his way into your heart. The Cairn terrier almost redeems terriers. The white poodle is appropriately regal and supercilious.  There are endless lame gay jokes, mostly cracked by the gay characters.  If you know anything about dog shows, this film is a hoot.
This movie has only a few laughs. Too bad, had some good actors with bad lines. Stars are for the cute dogs.

This may be Christopher Guest's best movie, though it's hard to choose. Certainly there are few characters as charming as Eugene Levy with two left feet. The depth of humor, played straight faced by an outstanding cast, is remarkable.
It was entertaining but really not as funny as I was told it would be.  Because I'm a dog lover and watch dog shows I thought it would be more interesting.

I have been in love with this movie since it first came out in 2001. As an ex Obedience Judge with the AKC, I can relate (somewhat) to the characters portrayed here! The actors are all the best . . . check out Waiting for Guffman and The Mighty Wind too! Too funny!
Could not watch the entire movie. Too disjointed, mixing in so many interrelated segments, I list interest before they were tied together.
Comedy at a great pace, like visiting a long-time welcome friend when i put it on again! 'Characters' doesn't even begin to cover this cast range.

This is the quintessential mockumentary and Christopher Guest's magnum opus. Everything about the film was perfectly done. The characterizations are blunt and tie perfectly into the plot which builds along with the comedy. There's an economy of words in the dialogue that makes sure every line adds to the comedic value of the film. The film isn't cheap, or lazy, about making fun of "dog people," as it masterfully sets-up characters to take the fall. The movie has great replay value as there's always some clever nuance to find and laugh at. Best In Show is a must-see comedy.
Cute movie with some funny moments. Worth watching on a rainy day'especially with a Prime Membership. The dog owners are too funny and remind me of many I have known.
Christopher Guest's best movie, hands down. This nails dog shows and dog owners to a tee. The cast is at their best!!
A good "mockumentary"  of the whole dog show circuit. Serious actors playing straight man against well known comedians. Enjoyable to watch.
I only watched about 15 minutes.  It was so bad I didn't want to see more.  I deleted and found something better.
Our whole family loves this movie. It is brilliantly acted and continuously funny. Great lines. A must. It never gets old. It makes us laugh every time.
Wanted to see more dogs instead of the owners, more show dogs. The movie was  was to silly for my taste.

One of my favorites. I'll never be able to watch the real AKC Best in Show again without thinking of this outrageous film. Dead on comic classic. Must see for all with an open mind to the sublime nature of the human ape.

You don't have to be a dog lover to enjoy this movie.  It is great fun!  You'll be laughing all the way through the movie. Although some of the characters seem to be stereotypes of certain people, they are developed well.  You feel like 'you know people like these people'!  The actors are all terrific and the dogs are beautiful.
Just a brilliant movie. Such smart humor, and a really great cast make for a good laugh-filled movie watching experience.
For side-splitting comedy. The tongue-in-cheek comedy is first class. A lot of the scenes and interviews are improvised.  All in all, a wonderful movie.
This movie is hilarious and it is exactly how I imagine the world of professional dog competition! It's a very witty take on a cultural phenomenon.

I love this and have watched it numerous times.
The cast is really great and I adore Eugene Levy.
Watch this !
One of my top 10 movies.  This is one to have in your collection for a raining day.  Great story with some wonderful charecters!!!
Seriously this was a waste of my time. I do have to confess that I only watched the first 20 minutes and that was enough.
Over the years when we want a good laugh we watch this movie! The diverse personalities of the characters (and their pets) add to the entertainment.

... But I found my morals challenged by the cavalier treatment of sex. It seems that the storyline of each of the main characters except Harlan Popper revolved around issues of sexuality, and in only one of the cases was it marital sexuality.  As hilarious as the characters were, I can't recommend the movie, because it flaunts without remorse the Biblical teachings on sex.  It wasn't just a passing thing; the writers made sure that sex was integral to our understanding of these characters.  What a shame.  These actors are obviously talented enough to have done well with a script that wasn't oblivious to the Bible and the Bible's celebration of sex within marriage!

This movie was not what I expected!  I bought it to watch with the children I care for during the week but was surprised to find the humor very adult.  It was funny and such a great study of the animal owners.  Kind of a documentary format.  The characters were diverse and very entertaining - from a gay couple to a trophy wife married to a man with one foot  in the grave.  The couple with the terrier was my favorite - he's a nerd and she's been around the block a few too many times but the dog is adorable!!
I love it. The real best in show recently aired and it's hilarious how little this movie is mocking the industry and how true to real life it really is.

There was no trailer to preview. Started the movie thinking it was okay to watch because of the rating and it was about dogs (pets). The sexual focus right at the beginning of the movie was so terrible and unnecessary within the first ten minutes that we shut it off.  Whether it's a parody or not, we just don't need to watch a movie that bad. We wouldn't suggest this movie to anyone.
It was ok a little to silly for me. I thought all the Adults acted very,very strange ! But OK

If you love comedy, you should be able to find a way to enjoy this movie. It's a little different than most of today's traditional comedy movies, but I think that makes it significantly better.  Try it out, you'll be happy you did!
Some funny bits but not a great movie thats worth sitting through. If you like dogs, there are some cute ones to see.
We could talk, or not talk, for hours, and still find things to not talk about.  If you get hungry, eat something! If you get tired, pull over!
I love all the mockumentaries!  They're all so quirky & fun.  Most of the actors are in all of them.  If you're looking for some off the wall humor, try one of these!

A show about extremely strange people that show dogs. The jokes alot of the time come from the commitment to each persons strange quirks, more so then just a funny joke.
Almost all the actors are second string for comdies but all have been in tons of movies and give first string performances.

These folks just make very witty, intelligent moves that also happen to be extremely funny.  Maybe hardcore dog people won't find this funny, as it hits pretty close to home, but regular folks should find it amusing.  Fred Willard is fantastic as the commentator of the dog show.

This is such a fun movie.....it's one that we always watch around the time of The Westminster Dog Show in February!  The acting ensemble is comedy at its best.  It's one of those movies that we never tire of, ever!

As a Boomer, I kept waiting for a movie to develop, but it never did.  Just a disjointed series of vignettes, which although funny for the first 5 minutes, gets mind-numbingly boring thereafter.  In other words, it was 119 minutes of my life I will never get back.
I had fond memories of this movie.  When I finally remembered the name, I found it on Amazon and it was aperfect birthday gift.

This movie is one of my all-time favorites, and it stands up well to repeat viewings.  Of all the movies the creators made in this semi-improv ensemble style (Waiting for Guffman, A Mighty Wind, etc), I think this one is by far the strongest.

My father is a veterinarian, and I grew up around pets, and pet owners, and pet breeders, and that experience makes the movie even more enjoyable, because as extreme as the characterizations may seem, they are actually grounded in the reality of the show breeding world.

If you love animals at the AKC show or the dog food show, This is an incredibly funny movie made by people who had to love dogs to carry it off. There are moments when Fred Willard just knocks you and Eugene Levy as the man with two left feet is perfect in timing. The whole cast with so much common interest is great. Enjoy it, it will be a fun experience.

This is the movie that demonstrated the comedy genius of Christopher Guest to me in a new way.  Not having grown up with Spinal Tap, and being only familiar with his role in "The Princess Bride," I had no idea of the group of improv kings and queens he leads or the creative ways in which they can cause eruptive laughter.  Watch it, you won't be sorry!  By the way, this is also the movie that introduced me to Jane Lynch.  What a great addition to the group!

If you like A Mighty Wind you will probably like this.  It is the same group that did Spinal Tap, Princess Bride, A Mighty Wind, and Waiting for Guffman.  This one is a "behind the scenes" look at dog shows and once you have seen a dog show this gets even funnier.  Plus there are some beautiful dogs too . . .

I watched this movie  on the recommendation of a co worker. I am glad it was included in my Prime  or I would have been  disappointed  that I  had paid money to see it. I didn't find it to be very funny .I watched to the end just to see which dog won.
Very funny movie with an odd bunch of characters. The dogs were fun to watch as well. Cute. Worth a watch.
Watch it over and over.  It is too funny. Will watch again tonight now that the Westminster dog show is finished.
This was not quite what I expected.  It was amusing at times but so much sexual humor I was glad I didn't have kids watching.  It has a weak plot and no real surprises.
Off humor, not really that funny.  The movie is very slow in spots.  I would skip this one as it is not worth your time.

A goofy and silly look at the people who show dogss. Not necessarily realisitc but true to Eugene Levy and Christopher Guest at their best as they look at the lives of everyday people living their everyday lives.
This was so funny.  All the actors did a great job in their different roles.  Made me laugh.  I would recommed this movie to watch.

The funniest pairing was that of the hot young woman with the wrinkly old man.  Now THAT had some mileage, but unfortunately, the story departed and you barely even saw the old man again.  Classic bait and switch.  Overall, kind of an odd movie. Was barely entertaining enough to watch the whole thing through, and if I had it to do over again, probably wouldn't.

a truly clever and hilarious bit of social commentary here......probably guest's best work. Those of us who saw Mr Garagiola
in the early televised dog shows will get a great laugh too.
BUYER BE WARNED: This is not much different to my late dad's 8mm home movies - both in humor and content. A clear effort to pass off junk as entertainment.

Hey, we have a Westie and she runs the house, so this movie was perfect for us.  I already had this movie, but I ordered one for my girlfriend who has two Yorkies that also run the house.  They loved it.  Thanks for the prompt and courteous service.  Looking forward to more purchases in the future.
Hilarious.  Exactly how some dog show handlers/owners operate.  Love the characters plus the shows history of them, etc.  Such a good crew.

Everyone with a bazaar sense of humor will enjoy this, but, if you show your dogs and have competed in the Conformation Rings hoping to get invited to Westminster one day, this is a "keeper."  The more you watch it, the more you spot, and the funnier it gets.
SIMPLE ENTERTAINMENT  AND DON'T TAKE YOURSELF TOOO SERIOUSLY. A WORL THAT HASN'T CHANGED IN  DECADES...TRY IT , YOU'LL AT LEAST SMILE

My niece went through a divorce and lost "custody" of her copy of Best in Show.  I sent it to her as a gift because it's one of the funniest movies ever made.  "I've taken baths in smaller vessels" (than that trophy)... ;)
Awesome movie.  I recommend it if you are a love lover.  Good comedy but I would not recomment it for kids
If you have ever taken any kind of dog class or shown any type of animal, you will love this movie.

I find I'm using Amazon nearly as often as Netflix.  Both are adequate and prices are reasonable.  As an Amazon Prime member, you receive additional value which is greatly appreciated.

Parker Posey is a riot in this film.  The rest of the cast is wonderful and I find I view this about every other year and enjoy it each time.
I love this movie! It is dry humor and I admit it is not for everyone but if you like the office, wes anderson, 30 rock, this movie is definitely something you should try.

This is a mockumentary by Christopher Guest and is hilarious.  Any movie by him is great.  Waiting for Guffman is great too but forsome reason is really pricy.  If your sense of humor is quirky and you can "get it" .  Watch this movie.  Have seen it many times and laugh every time.

I used to show dogs and this is a great spoof on the dog show game.  It is all exaggerated but so much of it has a ring of truth to it and that is what makes it so funny.  I have seen it several times and it still makes me laugh.
This was a gift to a dog lover and dog show enthusiast/ participant. Was very much enjoyed and laughed over.
This movie is a classic.  It is a family favorite.  Quirky and fun.  If you have a dog or like dogs you will love this movie
Classic entertainment.  Watch it before every dog show we are in.  It's a stress relief and pretty darn funny too

I remember seeing this movie on HBO when I was younger. Such a brilliant cast and underrated movie. I love indie movies. This movie is just pure comedy gold.  I was laughing throughout the whole thing and I never get sick of this. The fact that the majority of the movie is improvised shows these actors are geniuses. Highly recommend.
This movie was one of the worst movies I have ever seen. It doesn't even deserve one star, but they won't allow you to do negative stars.
I feel i have a dry sense of humor.  This one just didn't do it for me, but it did have a few moments.
This is one of my favorite movies, I have watched it many times and even though I know what's coming it still makes me laugh out loud. Great ensemble cast.  Love Jennifer Coolidge in anything!
I absolutely love this movie.  Watch it all the time with friends!  Has held up over time, good quality.  Great mockumentary.
I love best in show and this is just what I expected it to be.  Thank you very much for that.
This movie is hilarious I love it! The actors characters and humor are make it so good! I will watch it over and over.

Always  a great laugh. Bought it as a gift for someone else, but still recieved with many laughs.
Many Thanks

This movie comes from out of left field.  It is so different and original.  It is just a fun and humorous movie.  If you like dogs this movie is truly a must.  If you frequently find yourself staring at dog owners and wondering what is wrong with them then you absolutely have to watch this movie.  It's a good movie.
Everyone will adore this hilarious movie, but even more so if you know anything about animal competitons.  The human competitors behave the same, even if the animals are different species.

The meltdown over the Busy Bee is classic. I can't get enough of Harlan Pepper naming nuts.
I can watch this movie repeatedly as with most Guest movies. Love this cast.

I love Christopher Guest comedies.  He uses the same ensemble cast in his movies, and they're all great. You'll recognize most of them. This is by far my favorite of his movies, and one of my favorite movies of all time.  It's silly,  hilarious, and timely.  It'll make you fall in love with his cast and look for more of his movies.  There's the country boy with his bloodhound, the promiscuous owner with her innocent  husband, the neurotic argumentative couple who only want the best for their dog,and want a prize in the show, the dumb blonde married to a much older man, the gay couple with their little dog, and the commentators.  I may have left out some of the many story lines, but if you love this man's movies, you'll be thrilled with this one.  Great!!!!

An incredible send up of dog show culture.  One of the best  from Christopher Guest and Eugene Levy - and that's saying alot. This will appeal to dog owners, dog show folks and fans of SCTV and wry humor in general.  The entire cast delivers at the highest level, the writing is impeccable and shines throughout.  Fred Willard's performance in his supporting role is as good as it gets in a comedy.  You'll love it from beginning to end.
If you haven't seen this movie, rent or buy it now. No. Buy two or three copies. Your friends will love it.
I love this show and watch it at least once a year. Bought this one to loan out to friends.
We watch this movie over and over.  The characters are so likable and/or so recognizable.  The dogs are adorable. Their owners personalities are so familiar as well.

Not only do I love this DVD, but everyone I share this with does as well.  I had forgotten how much innuendo there is, but thank goodness kids don't get it!  Everyone else loves this.  We all know these dog owners, and nearly everyone I know who shows dogs says that this movie is really true.  These little stories... Why is it successful?  Because it plays the story totally straight. That is the best part of it.  Dog lovers BUY THIS!

This comedy group is the best.  I've seen this movie several times and I've told so many people about it, I figured I would just go ahead and buy it and share the laughs.  Now that we own dogs, it strikes me as even funnier.
A must see if you are into purebred dogs! If not, you still will enjoy, but it's a bit dry.
Jane Lynch and Jennifer Coolidge are the reason this movie is so dang funny. It's a quirky "independent-type-feel" movie, but it is really funny. The whole cast is great.

I have given this DVD to many people.  If I could I would give it a 5+  I show my dogs and Christopher Guest in his genius way has captured the Breed Ring World of Dogs and the crazy humans participating in it!
I bought this because I'm a dog lover---anything to do with dogs peaksw my interest...I've seen this in the theater---I bought this for my back-up!!

If you like animals, especially dogs....you'll love this movie!  It's Funny...Hilarious at some points and quite entertaining.
Even if you're not too crazy about animals you'll probably like it.
This is a very funny movie.  Maybe not for everyone, but this is my second copy...I wore the VCR tape out!
After seeing "Best in Show" I actually went to a huge dog show in NYC - the characters portrayed in the movie were so accurate it was hysterical!  Being a "dog person" I really enjoyed this film!
It's a fun family movie and I love dogs it was highly entertainibg and exterely cute ..u love movies that feature dogs
One of my favorite movies of all time.  Can watch this movie over and over again (which I do).  Terrific cast, funny as hell, this one is a cult classic and rightly so.
This is a sometimes witty mockumentary that was better the first time I watched it.  Don't plan on watching it again.

this is my first christopher guest film and i wasn't sure what to expect, but i LOVED it.  the cast is amazing and they are all extremely funny in their roles. this mockumentary makes you laugh because you can imagine that this is what really goes on with dog shows &/or people that are obsessed with their pets.  hilarious!!  1 of the funnier movies i've seen in a while!!  this is a film i could watch over and over again!!!
Love this movie--one of the funniest I've ever seen.  A friend is a "dog handler" and told me this movie is a lot "closer to reality" than you'd think.  Which is pretty scary!
For anyone that's a fan of Guest's mocumentaries! A decade later this movie still has me in tears! Great cast and writing!
This is one of those movies either you think its funny or you don't.  I myself did not find it funny at all, a few chuckles here and there.
Very funny movie, a tad slow in the beginning but it had many hilarious moments....great cast of well known actors.

This movie just makes us laugh.  What a wonderful reflection of how shameless we can all be when it comes to our little animal friends.  The characterizations that our so true to society.  We see these people everyday in one form or another and thats what connects us to this hilarious spoof.  Well done Christopher Guest and the other great actors in this movie.  A timeless gem for all generations.

The wife picked this one night, and I said OK, we'll check it out. I didn't expect much at first, boy, was I wrong!! B.I.S. is absolutely one of the funniest movies I have ever seen! Way worth a watch if you haven't seen it, way worth it to watch it again and again also!!

Best in Show is yet another collaboration of some of the brightest comedic talent of our generation.  Christopher Guest, Eugene Levy, Catherine O'Hara, Jennifer Coolidge, and the rest of the ensemble provide an hour and a half of laughs - especially for those who are more familiar with the world of professional dog shows.  Hilarious.  One of my favorite movies of all time & in my top 5 comedic films of all time.
These actors are at their best when working together.  What a hoot!  It will never get old. A great gift for dog lovers!
This is a great funny movie. The actors are fantastic, and it's get better with the other in the series!
It was not well acted. I found it very slow and boring...I would not recommend this movie to anyone. The humor was dry.
Very funny, a great movie to watch when you need a good laugh!! My kind of humor, the kind that takes real type!!
Who would have thought a guy with two left feet would steal a show! A real fun movie as a dog lover.
It's true! Go to any dog show and see! For that matter, go to any horse show and see the same nuts!
I enjoyed the satire (and probably some truth) about kennel club shows.  Some of the characters were hilarious. I also thought it was well cast.  It was a light, fun movie.
LOVE IT!! FUNNIEST MOVIE EVER ESPECIALLY IF YOU SHOW DOGS. SO MUCH OF IT IS SO TRUE BUT PRESENTED IN A HYSTERICAL WAY. IT'S MUST SEE! PURCHASE AT AMAZON.COM
What a riot !...The cast was great...laughed till our sides ached!...goes along with other "Docu-satires" of theirs, "Spinal Tap & A Mighty Wind"...

I love Christopher Guest and the gangs movies. Waiting for Guffman, and Best in Show are my favorites, and I could watch them over and over. If you are a fan of improv, then you should definatley check this one out!

Best in Show takes you behind the scenes of the dog show in satirical fashion. It's presented as a documentary which is tongue in cheek hilarious. I love watching Eugene Levy and Catherine O'Hara together as a couple and Parker Posey is terrific in her role as dog "mommy". The pressure is on to be the best in show and the stress mounts in the days leading up to the event. The dog owners fret with anticipation over making sure the dogs are pampered and properly prepped before the show.
Great actors in an all star cast. Funny all the way through. Classic. Parker is funny and entertaining as always. It is about time for Cat Fancier lol.

This movie was so bad, we couldn't finish watching it.
It's in the trash where it belongs.  A waste of money.
This is one of my favorite movies ever and my husband hates it! I think I have more of a dry sense of humor. My mom loves it and my dad hates it and both of them have good sense of humors i think????

Each couple is a caricature in this 2001 comedy, only they aren't all that funny. I really wish we had seen more of the dogs, who steal every scene they are in. The final third is the big dog show, but mostly it's a somewhat tedious focus on the two commentators, one of whom makes off-color jokes while the staid Brit plays straight man. This is gentle stuff, but not very exciting.

This was a moderately funny takeoff on the dog show people and their dogs.  The people and dogs were all depicted as abberant personalities of various types.  Straight and otherwise, the dogs also were quirky.

I looked all around for this movie, from best buy to target even went to a bunch of pawn shops. I really wish I would have come here first. The price was great, and it got here super fast (before it said it would) I will definitely buy here again and again.

Best in Show has to be one of the funniest movies around. It's the kind of humor that makes you sit and get absorbed into the movie. When it's over you'll have a different favorite character every time. A must buy for your collection.

Buck Laughlin: I'd hate to go on a date with Judge Edie Franklin and have her judge me, that'd be no fun.

Downright Bizarre ,witty Humor. Reminds me of the early seasons of " The Office. Plot not as good as " A Mighty Wind " But is ten times better than the critically acclaimed " Spinal Tap ". You might only like this if you have pets or you know about how weird dog shows get. My aunt is a judge for dog shows. My cousin and her husband breed and show their dogs. They are down to earth. Some of the other contestants, not so much. The characters of the film are original and very off the beaten path,so to speak. Fred Willard plays this obnoxious announcer that you want to smack. There isn't much dialog, but the facial expressions , esp Eugene Levy and Ed Begley Jr's are to die for. The way this art piece is done reminds me of the Carol Burnett Sketches. Don't let young kids or hypersensitive people watch this. They will be bored out of their skulls because this movie moves at a leisurely pace,plus their is a lot of sexual inneundo in it. But it is tastefully done so they might not even notice it. One couple almost ruined the movie for me. They were sooo spiteful and mean to their pooch and to each other. I kept hoping the dog would run away or poop on them.

This was a gift for a friend that had never seen it (how is that possible? I have no idea, either), and has watched it multiple times since.  If you need/want a good laugh, GET THIS FILM, but I suggest getting 2 while you are at it, as some unsuspecting guest or family member will no doubt take your copy.
Meh, it was ok. I thought parts were funny, but the dry humor got tiresome after a while. I won't watch it again. (and Jane Lynch is WAY overrated)
Whats not to love about Best In Show? As the owner of 3 dogs I get a kick out of how different owners are portrayed. Very funny movie, the actors chose for the parts are perfect.

I bought this movie after seeing Jane Lynch in Glee - I remembered this film from years ago and when I saw the low price I couldn't resist. Jane sure has great comedic range - her role is very different from the crazy cheerleading coach in Glee and she does a great job in both roles. This film has a great ensemble cast, all with different styles. The format switches between stories of all the contestants preparing for and then participating in the dog show, intermingled with sports-announcing commentary. For me Fred Willard's performance giving that commentary, clearly mostly improv, was the highlight of the film. To be honest, after buying this on Amazon I got email notice that I could watch it as a free download and I did that - so I have not yet opened the disc. After reading some of these reviews, I am looking forward to checking out the deleted scenes and the commentary track. All in all, this is a great dry comedy along the lines of This is Spinal Tap (Special Edition) and is very much worth viewing whether or not you like dogs (though liking dogs is a plus!). As Nigel in Spinal Tap might say "it's an 11."
This film has got to be one of the funniest and best ever. I gave it a 5 star rating but really it deserves a 10! Christopher Guest is absolutely the BEST!

Christopher Guest and his regular cast of improv legends tackle another unsuspecting target in this wild-eyed send up of the competitive dog show circuit. It's a bit more all-audiences than Spinal Tap, while completely skipping the emotional hooks of A Mighty Wind or Waiting For Guffman, but still delivers enough legit snickers to validate a simple retirement as late-night cable network filler. The straight-ahead plot never shows much interest in progressing beyond simple character-driven adventure, and while each member of the cast is good for a smart punchline or two, the roles themselves are universally shallow, narrow caricatures. Fine as a background flick, thrown on to fill the air when your focus will be frequently elsewhere, it will never quite reach the same level as its siblings.
I think this movie was in extremely poor taste on all counts.  I know it was supposed to be "satiracal" but I found it offensive.

This movie is genius. The cast is so wonderful and enjoyable in every moment. I want to get in their world and live there. This is such a good natured film. I enjoyed the talking, and the not talking, snow peas, soup. I could watch or not watch this movie for hours.

Or at least understand the game. Personally, I find it more of a documentary than a mocumentary. I breed show dogs, and know some of the background people in this movie. Just a tidbit of trivia, all of the dogs and extras in the movie came from a dog show that was going on in Vancouver at the time of filming.

Yes, dog people are this crazy. I noticed some of the negative reviews complained about it dragging and slow, well that's what happens in dog shows. If you pass your dog to a professional handler, you don't dare talk to them until everything is over because they're "in the zone". And a lot of dog shows is sitting around commenting about other dogs, and overhearing comments about your dog. Yes, I have turned to others in the bleachers and said "that's my dog" or even "that's my dog's sire".

That being said, I also think people who take the sport too seriously (you know who you are) may dislike this movie because they feel that they are being made fun of.

I don't buy a lot of movies, but I had to have this one. It's great to have a supply of movies for those evenings when you feel 'fried' from a stressful day. This is one of those movies - smart, subtle humor combined with a bit of outright silliness;  endearing characters; and something I look forward to watching again. Anyone who loves dogs, knows dog owners, or has ever been to a dog show has got to see this!

I only watched Avatar and Titanic once, and even with TBS showing Dumb and Dumber every 4.5 hours I have still seen this movie (willingly) more often...so what results in being entertained by a movie to the point that a relatively normal person would watch it over 100 times?

Characters, characters, characters! That's what.  I believe I watch it so much in hopes of learning something new about each character, and I often do!  And a huge dose of genius by the writers doesn't hurt either.  One day movie makers will learn that is what we crave, not special effect.  Short of the pan down to Eugene Levy's two left feet, I don't think there is a single special effect :)

This classic comedy has one of the best casts in movie history.  The movie follows several groups of dog owners on their quest to be Best In Show at the Mayflower Dog Show.
Every scene is comedy history.  The subtleties of the characters shine as bright as the line-up of stars itself.  Every sentence is delivered with an acting precision seldom seen.  Yet, at the same time, you get the feeling much of it was improved as they went along.

Eugene Levy stands out, Fred Willard shows up just in time to steal the show.  And, all actors will leave you smiling and watching this movie over and over.

Put this atop of the "I wish there was a sequel to that..." list.

there really is not a story line it's built in a documentary style it flips back and forth constantly with very dry low brow humor.
i wasn't expecting to see them over exaggerate and mock people at dog shows...more of an insult than a comedy.

the dogs really don't even have a place in it and that is the feel i get from it, where are the dogs? where is the funny?

it was ok i did find some of it enjoyable but i was annoyed by the constant frame switching and moments where the actors seem to be bored by their own lines.

This  is the type of movie you have to be in the mood for , the character acting was SUPERB, the acting delicious, and the timing was very saturday night live -ish. Would have been better 40 minutes shorter. Not a keeper.
Loved this movie and if you get the dvd you get the deleted scenes. Ah it's hilarious he talks about southern dialects in one and ah it's great. Good movie. And the price is wonderful.

This cast is great.  I laughed the whole time.  There is outward humor and subtle  humor which just makes you laugh the whole entire time.  Not only that  - but you discover more funny stuff the more you watch it.  If you have seen For Your Consideration then you would love this movie no doubt.  Please buy!

Christopher Guest documentary style comedy at it's best!  Be prepared for a roller coaster ride of insanity as a wide range of crazed dog owners prepare for the big event.  The ensemble cast includes most of Guest's improv regulars we have come to love, and they do not disappoint.  Catherine O'Hara is particularly hilarious as the seemingly conservative suburban housewife "Cookie" whose promiscuous past continues to catch up with her throughout the movie.  Eugene Levy is the perfect foil as her nerdish husband trying to cope with frequent embarrassment.  This is one of those rare, spirited, side-splitting comedies you can watch over and over again and laugh harder each time.  Don't forget to watch the outtakes and commentary provided on this DVD version.  For you comedy lovers out there, this is a must have!
This is a really funny fake documentory about the challenges of competing at a dog show. The laughs don't stop and the talented cast really made the characters come to life.

This movie was hysterical in its parody of the psychotic dog owners and how sadly serious they take their pets.  There are not a ton of outright jokes (the TV broadcaster covering the show throws some out) it is all poking fun at the over the top dog owner and the great lengths they go to for their pet.  I think those who will find it the funniest know a friend or family member who lives a similar life (usually childless-like the ones in the movie:).  I have a relative who does ridiculous things for their pet and spends a ton of money on it that is not necessary.  I honestly think some people would save their dog over a person they treat them so crazy.  Mind you, I am a dog person and love my dog, take care of it well but she doesn't go to a day spa and have jewelry!  You can treat dogs respectfully without pampering them to excess and making your whole world revolve around them; to me it seems the core of this movie is making fun of those who cross the line between pet owner and pet pampering to extremes.  I think the negative reviewers had different expectations (one even thought it was a documentary-Ha!).  It is a total farcical look at dog owners going to a dog show and how depressingly seriously they take it (so much so it is funny).  Hope this helps.

"Best in Show" is Christopher Guest's hilarious parody of the dog show world. I bought this DVD because I wanted to have the film in my library simply because it is one of the funniest movies of all time. Every single actor/actress in this "mocumentary" is memorable.
Highly recommended.

After reading some of the negative reviews, I am of the opinion that some "canine dependent" types are not amused to see themselves so ridiculed.  The fact is,  Christoper Guest does to some dog-lover types what deserves to be done to some dog-lover types.  The movie is hilarious.  Nothing on the planet is more amusing than a dog show, and Mr. Guest pulls no punches.  If you are a real person, you will find this movie very very funny.

Best in Show comes from the geniuses behind This is Spinal Tap.  The mockumentary about a dog show in Philadelphia (think Westminster in NY) is hilarious, especially if you have ever either been a part of the competitive show world as a competitor or just someone who likes dogs.  The characters, while "types," are well drawn and the film perfectly captures the quirkiness of the competitors and the insanity of dog shows.  I don't think I stopped laughing the entire time, although some of the characters were more endearing than others (the yuppie couple of Parker Posey and Kyle McLaughlin, while well-acted, were not particularly pleasant).  Eugene Levy with his two left feet (really -- two left feet!), was especially funny and sweet.  And Jane Lynch, who plays a lesbian handler, shows the origins of her Glee character.  I highly recommend this dvd.
Sadly we were very excited initially to receive the DVD, then found we couldn't play it on our player
This movie is awkwardly rewarding. Plenty of moments to laugh at. Great acting all around. The dogs all look good and so does Jane Lynch. Worth the money!

I've seen the entire set of Christopher Guest mockumentaries and, since none has appeared since "For Your Consideration," I'm beginning to panic at the thought that the series has come to an end.  It's hard to explain why a cult classic like "This Is Spinal Tap" can underwhelm some of us while the Guest send-ups (of the dog show world, of aspiring Hollywood stars, of community theater enthusiasts, of the folk-singing culture of the '60s) are so addictive.  Part of it is the repertory company that consistently appears (Guest, Levy, Willard, O'Hara, etc.).  The first film becomes better with each succeeding film as you marvel at the adaptability of the characters (I didn't even recognize Guest in "Waiting for Guffman").  The observation of human nature is as sharp as the eye of a Jaques Tati but never prone to misfires, dull stretches, pointless routines--because the films are organized around a driving compulsion that simply must be seen from inception to conclusion.  The characters are "types" but not so over-the-top as to lose their recognizability. And remarkably, I have yet to see a character who, regardless of his or her ticks and obsessions, is unlikable.  Don't expect to be rolling in the aisles (or falling out of bed) but don't be surprised if an occasional howler isn't forceful enough to wake up a nearby companion (they should have been watching, anyway).

Relating the specifics of the plot. characterizations and comedy would be an exercise in futility (what's funny let alone believable about a schlep with 2 left feet?).  But in our hyper, over-glitzy, over-computerized and overly-produced, "virtual" worlds that pass for entertainment--from Spieberg over-achieving epic "events" to more Robin Williams' feel-good formulae to contrived Ben Stiller family commodities to some of the grosser whoopee cushion films that try to appeal to alternative tastes in low humor--the Guest films emerge as a sort of last frontier for creative, childlike adult minds to approach the making of movies with enthusiasm and gusto, not to mention the old-fashioned-way.  Special-effects technicians need not apply.
This flic is just about what we see at almost all dog shows we do...and we do have two Best-in-Shows on our main boy!
If you're into dogs, dog shows, anything by Christopher Guest and mockumentaries, this is the movie for you!!
The best of the genre.  Willard Scott is a treasure, and so is everyone else in the cast.

A very funny movie. Having been involved in showing dogs over the last 20 years I feel I have met most of the types
portrayed and a few more. Believe me they're out there! The dog show world can be a very strange and funny place.

Best in Show has so many fans that it is difficult to say anything original about it. The film concerns several dog owners who travel to Philadelphia in hopes that their dogs will win the coveted "Best in Show" award.

The film is not really about the dogs; it is about the people who love them. People reveal their foibles in the way that they treat their dogs and the competition. My favorite was the yuppie couple (Parker Posey and Michael Hitchcock) who met at Starbucks. They tear into each other when things don't go their way.

Christopher Guest plays a man from Pine Nut, North Carolina, who takes his bloodhound to the show. I laughed when one of the "homefolk" told the bloodhound "You go up there and put some hurt on them Yankee dogs."

My only warning about this film is that the humor is subtler than is the humor in most comedies. Fans of Jim Carrey and Chevy Chase are likely to be disappointed.

I strongly recommend Best in Show.

i knew i loved the film, having seen it

i thoiught that i had found a good price for 2 as a gift in a store

but amazon's price was better

BEST IN SHOW(2000)---Eugene Levy, Catherine O'Hara, Christopher Guest, Michael McKean, Fred Willard. Parker Posey, Jennifer Coolidge, Jane Lynch, John Michael Higgins, Michael Hitchcock
A very funny(IMO) satire from the same gang that brought you THIS IS SPINAL TAP, WAITING FOR GUFFMAN, A MIGHTY WIND, etc. The targets here are "big-time" dog shows and the people who participate in them. Everybody plays it absolutely straight, which only adds to the "humor quotient". The film focuses on: a small-town married couple who are participating in their first major dog show; a gay couple---one an "over the top queen"---the other, a more sedate, "responsible" type; another married couple who are absolutely neurotic over the whole "dog-show" business and who take their dog to a therapist when the pooch is traumatized by seeing them having sex in an "unusual" position they gleaned from the Kama-Sutra; the proprietor of a fishing equipment business; and an Anna Nicole Smith-type airhead with a pneumatic chest who just happens to be married to an ancient millionaire---she is in partnership with a lesbian "dog-handler", who has won several "Best in Show" awards. Fred Willard plays a crass, "clueless" TV commentator covering the dog show. I found this an extremely funny film and it is "spot-on" in its satirical take on the subject. Levy and Willard are especially funny, but the whole cast is excellent in their respective roles.

As a Christopher Guest fan, I have enjoyed all his films, from "Waiting for Guffman" to "For Your Consideration." But as an animal lover as well--and frequent observer of the Westminster Dog Show at Madison Square Garden each year--I am a particular admirer of "Best in Show"--which I have seen several times. It captures the genuine love, devotion, talent--and eccentricities, obsessivesness, and laugh-out-loud humor of the world of dog shows, the pet owners, and the TV commentators. Best of all--Guest has affection for the subjects he is satirizing, and laughs with them, not at them. The performances of his usual ensemble are extraordinary--both witty and touching. Tightly edited (not a wasted moment), this little film is a comedic treasure that stand up to repeated viewings.

Apparently there are some people who have a negative impression of this film. Fine, but its not a slapstick comedy with goofy jokes. It is satirical and the humor is dry. All of the characters are stereotyped which makes this film so funny. Its not about the dogs, its about the characters who own them. I believe that if you do not think this film is funny then you either are comedically impaired, or lacking some IQ points.
This movie might have been funny if the characters were likable or interesting.  They aren't.  Not everyone finds off-color humor hilarious, believe it or not.

"Best in Show" is the best of the excellent four Christopher Guest improv movies.  I suppose you could trace the origin of this run back to "This is Spinal Tap".  If you are not familiar with "Waiting For Guffman", "A Mighty Wind", and "Four Your Consideration", "Best in Show" is the place to start.

Comedy that is smart, funny, and so perfectly performed by a true ensemble cast has to be in everyone's collection.  BUY THIS MOVIE!

This movie is unquestionably PG-13.  I found this movie a bit too vulgar in many places.  But that does not change the fact that this was a very funny movie, and very well done.

There are deleted scenes included after the VHS version of this product.  Those scenes weren't at all bad -- some of them were deleted because the movie went a different direction with a couple of the aftermath stories, while others would have just made the movie longer.  The deletion of the scenes shows that they made the movie just the correct length and knew when to stop.  Other movies went on to a part of boredom, and this movie did not.

I am doing research on dog shows for a novel I'm writing.  "Best In Show" is not making fun of dog shows but rather having fun with them.  From the audience's point of view, the stars are the dogs.  With the exception of Beatrice the Weimaraner, the dogs didn't really contribute to the movie.  In the movie, the focus was on the characters.

A couple of reviews say people take dog shows too seriously, and some do but for others it's an enjoyable hobby.  For example, I went to an agility show and it seems to be where people and dogs can have fun together.  The conformity part, which is where this movie focuses (there are also obedience trials and herding as well as agility, and the same dog may compete in several of these events), is more of the beauty pagaent, but the reality is it is a group of animal lovers.  Some are as quirky as the characters in the movie, but not all.

One strength was the low key approach to the movie.  John Michael Higgins and Fred Willard have stand out performances, but they would be best described as "flamboyant" rather than over the top.  While there is some suspension of disbelief in this movie (e.g. Eugene Levy's character having two left feet), the characters are all realistic and not removed from real life.  My hunch is that if a viewer is rooting for a certain character it is a subjective choice, and a different viewer may identify just as strongly with a different character.  There are no antagonists.  The only character I was hoping wouldn't win were the two-time defending champion, just because they were the two-time defending champion (I have the same view in sports as well).

The casting is perfect.  There are hints of improv in here.  It doesn't have a completely unscripted feeling but there are parts where I have a hunch that an actor has his own script but does not know (or at least does not expect) what another actor will say.  My favorite joke is that the Yuppie couple met at Starbucks -- not the same Starbucks:  they saw each other in different Starbucks across the street from each other.  (I also liked the "Phantom Hill" joke in the extra scenes.)

I've never watched the Spinal Tap movie (or Guffman) but I saw the TV special.  Christopher Guest and Michael McKean (one of my favorite comic actors) were in the TV version.  I think I caught a Spinal Tap allusion when the hotel manager was talking about a rock band staying there.

The quality of the artmanship earned this movie the five stars I'm giving it.  I was embarrassed and disgusted with parts of this movie, because of my world view.  Likewise, I would not recommend that children see this movie.  What is needed is a straight PG (if not G) rated movie on dog shows so that children can enjoy the story as well.

I suggest reaction to this film will vary according to who likes pets and who doesn't. If you're like me and you'd like to care for your pet until it turns 30 against the advice of your vetrinarian, you might feel you're being laughed at, but then, if you're like the neighbor on the corner who might chase you with a rifle if he catches a dog pooing in his yard, well, this IS the film for you! The satire does contain some very cute and original characters. This topic would tempt most film makers to mimic real people. The originality of its comedy did surprise me.

Obsessive-compulsive behavior is everywhere.  Highly competitive people seem attracted to endeavors that encourage it.  That's why this mock documentary is so funny--dog owners and dog trainers spending time, money and angst in search of that big win in that big show where the "Best in Show" win becomes national news.

This is character driven comedy that shows a variety of people caught up in the drama of the "Mayflower Dog Show" a stand-in for the Westminster Kennel Club dog show.  Nearly all of the characters depicted in this movie are endearing goofballs who love their dogs. The one exception is the yuppie couple that everyone will love to hate.  Not only are they neurotic and obnoxious but they project those traits on to their dogs...

The dogs are real champions and tremendous good sports although their body language frequently reveals that they are interacting with actors and not their real "people".  The movie follows the rule that the owners somehow "match" the type of dog, so the bloodhound man gives folksy nutty monologues, the gay couple with the Shih-Tzus redecorate their hotel room just for the night and the modest brown Norwich terrier is carried around by a woman who wears LOUD printed blouses that are down to THERE.

The know-nothing TV commentator is also amusing.  He's been doing it for years and never learned a thing, one gathers.

Maybe this is not laugh-out-loud comedy, but it is becoming almost an annual favorite, trotted out every year or so whenever Westminster is in the news.  If it is not "Best in Show", it's certainly a winner nonetheless.
Just thinking about some of the lines in this movie makes me laugh outloud. Hilarious cast, hilarious dialogue and delivery. I can watch this movie over and over again
The funniest movie I ever saw.  I have watched it 4 times already and find something I missed each time.  I recommend this movie highly.

This movie will never get old. I can watch Best In Show over and over (i have) and It kills me every time. I love every single couple. Parker Posey is hilarious in her braces and eugene levy and his two left feet. Wow. I don't want to give anything away. Just buy the movie. It's worth every penny.

The few poor reviews for this movie make me wonder if they are for a different movie, or possibly the reviewers lost their senses of humor at birth. I can just see the box for this movie and the laughs will start again. If you have ever laughed at Eugene Levy, Catherine O'Hara, Fred Willard, or Christopher Guest, I don't see how this movie won't cause a few laughs. Take a few somewhat neurotic people, their babies (normal to slightly neurotic dogs) and one giant dog show, stir them all up, and trust me, it will be funny. I am seriously concerned for anyone that can't laugh at this movie. Will you be more sophisticated after watching this movie? No. Will your blood pressure be lower? Should be. Will you be glad you don't take Muzzy to dog shows? Surely. Relax, its a movie, a very funny movie!
This has got to be the worst movie I have ever seen.  Please don't waste your money!  Gave it one star only because I had to give it something in order to proceed.  Need negative stars on there!
This movie is one of my all-time favorites. It's hilarious! Do not miss this movie. It's one you can watch again and again.
This is the best movie ever. I have watched it over and over and over again and never get sick of it. It is so hilarious that you have to buy it because you will want to see it again and again.

Excellent, if you have dogs, then this is the movie for you.  It's hilarious and funny.
Some of the couples you can relate to in every day life.  We sure did!
Gotta get it!

While I find nothing wrong with Christopher Guest's mocumentary films, and most times even find them incredibly funny, "Best in Show" missed its mark. Guest continously puts his characters in awkwardly funny situations that should make the audience chuckle and laugh, but I just don't see it. The film took itself seriously, which is what most audiences loved, but I just couldn't get into it. The characters are well-rounded and developed, the cinematography is great, but the plot just doesn't go anywhere. The film follows a group of dog show contestants on the road to, and during, a national dog show competition, and that's it. There's no twists. There's no punch lines. There's no relief factor. Just ninety minutes of owners and their dogs. I could have easily gotten the same thing on Animal Planet.

Take a North Carolina country boy, a Midwest suburban (bipolar) couple, a nerd with two left feet and his former nymph wife, two rather flaming beauty salon operators, a gold-digging wife and her lesbian dog trainer, mix in some interesting canines (who, ironically, are the only stable beings in sight), plug them all into the high stakes tension that is the (fictitious) Mayflower Dog Show, and you've got BEST IN SHOW. Christopher Guest, who has made comedic improv "mockumentaries" an art form, hits the funny bone yet again with his ensemble cast of lovable loons who take competitive dog showing just a tad too seriously. Improvisational comedy takes a special talent, so Guest employs several Second City veterans to wing it in front of the camera (including Eugene Levy, Catherine O'Hara, Michael McKean, and Fred Willard). While Guest's character (whose name is Harlan Pepper, a classic) and Fred Willard (an empty suit TV announcer) tend to get annoying, the rest of the cast improvs and interacts in pure comedic camaraderie. In particular, McKean and John Michael Higgins chew up every scene they're in as two very gay boutique operators and dog show enthusiasts; yes, they stumble over every gay stereotype in the book, but they do so with tongue-in-cheek good humor. Special features. This edition includes commentaries by cowriters Guest and Levy; both comics basically go through the motions and offer little insight behind the scenes. Several deleted scenes are available; once viewed, it becomes readily apparent why they were not included in the final cut. Special feature disappointments aside, BEST IN SHOW is pure, tight, improvisational bliss--a howler in a good way. --D. Mikels, Author, Walk-On
Dog lovers will enjoy this movie, with it's adult situations and humor.  The dog show commentary is especially funny.

I seldom re-watch movies. Once I see a movie, I feel it's a waste of valuable lifetime moments to watch it again. My definition of a 'favorite movie' therefore, is one I like to watch over and over again and love it every time. I am 50 years old and there are only about 3-4 movies that fall into this category for me. Best in Show is definitely one of them. It is one of the most hilarious movies I have ever seen. There are not just a few funny parts, this movie is jam packed with funny lines, ridiculous characters, and preposterous situations. Whether you have a twisted sense of humor (me), or just your everyday normal person sense of humor, you will love this movie. I don't know how to label the type of comedy in this dvd, so I'll just say this; Imagine all your favorite Seinfeld characters at their very best, then multiply it about 20 times. You will laugh all the way through this movie. Love it, love it, love it!!!!
One of the best comedies ever; this looks like it was a lot of fun to make; I watch it over and over

My husband actually turned me onto this movie.  The first time I saw it, I was completely surprised.  But, the second time I was hooked.

These actors are truly amazing.  Considering they have done other movies as well, I'm mesmorized at the manner in which they can take on a new persona with each movie.

There is no picking a favorite in this movie when it comes to a person or scene - because the whole thing is just great.

If you don't have a sense of humor that's a little off to the side, then this probably isn't the movie for you.  But, if you like things with some interesting twists (which that absolutely has), you'll love it.
The Packaging Amazon sent the movie in was not padded and the little disc that holds the CD in was broken.

Tell the truth! there aren't very many movies that are really worth owning. Sure, you've gotAkira Kurosawa's Seven Samurai (Shichinin No Samurai) ~ Original Theatrical Version [Import, All-region] (Dvd), but how many times are you going to watch it? Well, this perfectly silly movie is one that you may watch so often that you start to memorize the dialog. What makes it so addictive is the utter seriousness of the characters about their very small world. Christopher Guest and Eugene Levy have created a compelling blank screen-the world of competitive dog shows-on which their regular cast of characters can project themselves and (gasp!) illuminate us as well. You'll flip for Parker Posey's description of a courtship whose basis is the lovers having two different coffee shops together. You will probably recognize the gay couple who whose roles lead to an inevitable tension and the 40 year old virgin married to the well-travelled woman who keeps stumbling on her old lovers. Tom Wolfe The Pumphouse Gang talked about folks creating small worlds in which to feel big. Best in Show is one of those worlds, it's earnestly felt and hilarious. Simply well done with the great ensemble cast that made Waiting for Gufman and would later make A Might Wind.  Funny, funny film.  Plus great dogs.

This is a great movie for anyone who has ever shown dogs.  While it is something of a satire, it really shows some of the crazy personalities that you see when you spend many weekends on the road traveling to shows.  I have shown dogs for over 30 years and still am amazed at this quirky world. This is a movie to watch again and again.

A Christopher Guest masterpiece.  Whether or not you're a dog lover, you'll enjoy the hilarious characters and humorous situations that are depicted throughout this video. Certain to become a "cult classic" that you'll watch repeatedly.

A dog-loving friend whose wife judges dog shows has been hounding me to watch this film for years. Finally, I rolled over and fetched a copy. Now, I can tell him not only that I watched this film, but that I virtually wolfed it down.

"Best in Show" follows a handful of hopefuls for the coveted top prize at the fictional Mayflower Kennel Dog Show, held in Philadelphia. The film is a mocumentary in which the participants are shown (as by a film crew) in their homes, in interviews, with their friends and preparing for the show. The participants hail from all over the US and represent identifiable types. There's the gay couple, the Southern good-ol' boy, the nerd, the slut, the beauty queen, the irritable yuppies and the lesbian. The characters rarely interact directly -- a scene in which flamboyant Scott Donlan (John Michael Higgins) tries to freak out straight-laced Gerry Fleck (Eugene Levy) is an exception -- and are usually shown in private moments with their animals. We meet a harried hotel manager, the show's fusty manager and the out-tight kennel club president. We also meet the media, in the personages of Buck Laughlin (Fred Willard), an airheaded, sex-obsessed TV host, and Trevor Beckwith (Jim Piddock), his exasperated dog-expert sidekick. The humor is neither subtle nor mean, and never lets up.

The selection of stereotyped characters is hilarious and is generally played sympathetically, but is occasionally predictable. The gay couple fussily redecorates its hotel room -- replacing pillows and tacking up wall coverings. The yuppie couple is neurotically obsessed with clothing brands, psychiatrists and Starbucks. The laconic Southern gentleman runs a fishing gear store and dreams of being a ventriloquist. Funny as it is, the film often takes its parody a bit too close to (and occasionally over the edge of) believability. One character's wife keeps running into old boyfriends who are a bit too graphic in their reminiscences. A bit of restraint here would have gotten the message across better. Still, the DVD's deleted scenes show that material that stretched the characters even further out of shape was mercifully left out of the final product.

All in all, "Best in Show" was an enjoyable way to spend a Saturday evening. Uncharacteristically, my wife and I laughed out loud quite often. Over-the-top characterizations aside, the film's depictions of the dog show world are fairly accurate (according to my friend, who would know), down to the cast of actually championship dogs. Comedy aside, I found the dog show world fascinating and would love to attend an event. Which goes to show that Christopher Guest's treatments -- whether of heavy metal, folk music or dog shows -- are always loving homages to the eccentricities of the participants and celebrations of their unique contributions to our culture.

Written and directed by one of the main players behind the classic 'rockumentary' 'This Is Spinal Tap', 'Best in Show' is a prickly, yet ultimately wryly affectionate look at the world of dog shows. Filmed in a mock documentary style, the story follows several folks of very different backgrounds - ranging from Posey's immature yuppie to Guest's slack jawed yokel - who all desperately want to win the Philadelphia Mayflower Dog Show and have their animal proclaimed the 'Best in Show'. Guest's direction is assured throughout, but the real stars are the character actors he so skilfully utilises and supplies with an extremely funny and witty script.

Best In Show features Christopher Guest's group of misfits reuniting for another go around.  This time, they're spoofing dog shows, and they a pretty good job of it too.

It's dog shows, dog shows, dog shows, and the twisted owners that put these dogs through this hassle.  One of the better comedies of the decade.

Featuring a commentary from Christopher Guest and Eugene Levy, the DVD is one to have.  A few featurettes and additional scenes round out this wonderful release.

Definitely recommended.
This is a really fun movie and funny too.  You will not be disappointed.

Hilarious vignettes of various colorful dog show entrants and their pooches add up to one of the top comedies of the past ten years. Guest's send-up of various American types include a Southern rube and a gay couple, but the laughter is never mean-spirited. Willard's side-splitting turn as a clueless broadcast announcer is truly for the ages.

Many prefer "Waiting for Guffman," but this is the one I could watch over and over again. The story focuses on the Mayflower Kennel Club in Philadelphia and the dog owners/trainers involved in the competition who are going after the "Best in Show" title for their pooch. Gerry & Cookie Fleck (Eugene Levy and Catherine O'Hara) are a couple from Florida; he's a nerd with two left feet (literally) and she is a former "reformed" tramp who seems to have old trick pop up at the most inopportune times. Meg & Hamilton Swan (Parker Posey & Michael Hitchcock) are a couple who put their dog in therapy because the dog saw them having sex and appears to be traumatized. Harlan Pepper (Christopher Guest) is a hick from North Carolina with a bloodhound. Christy Cummings (Jane Lynch) is the trainer for the favored dob, owned by Sherri Ann Ward Cabot (Jennifer Coolidge), a kind-hearted bimbo who is married to a rich old geezer. A Shih Tzu owned by a flamboyant gay couple, Scott Donlan (John Michael Higgins) & Stefan Vanderhoof (Michael McKean), is also part of the competition. Although much of this movie was supposedly improvised, the editing on this particular Guest movie makes it fantastic. No slow-moving moments (other than Guest's sequences) and Coolidge steals the show. So many memorable one-liners  here. Deleted scenes are included, and again, we can be thankful that even more painful moments from Guest were removed. Commentary by Guest & Levy is fun and informative. Theatrical Trailer also included.
